subject: Biology
title: DNA Double Helix
description: The B-DNA structure showing major and minor grooves. Backbone is sugar-phosphate. Base pairs: A=T, G-C (Triple Bond). Pitch is 3.4nm.
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 200 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><defs><linearGradient id='dna_grad' x1='0%' y1='0%' x2='100%' y2='0%'><stop offset='0%' style='stop-color:#10B981;stop-opacity:1' /><stop offset='100%' style='stop-color:#34D399;stop-opacity:1' /></linearGradient></defs><path d='M60,10 Q100,60 60,110 T60,210 T60,310' stroke='url(#dna_grad)' stroke-width='8' fill='none'/><path d='M140,10 Q100,60 140,110 T140,210 T140,310' stroke='#059669' stroke-width='8' fill='none'/><line x1='60' y1='30' x2='140' y2='30' stroke='#6EE7B7' stroke-width='4' /><line x1='80' y1='85' x2='120' y2='85' stroke='#6EE7B7' stroke-width='4' /><line x1='60' y1='130' x2='140' y2='130' stroke='#6EE7B7' stroke-width='4' /><line x1='80' y1='185' x2='120' y2='185' stroke='#6EE7B7' stroke-width='4' /><line x1='60' y1='230' x2='140' y2='230' stroke='#6EE7B7' stroke-width='4' /><text x='10' y='30' font-family='Arial' font-size='12' fill='#333'>5'</text><text x='180' y='30' font-family='Arial' font-size='12' fill='#333'>3'</text></svg>

subject: Biology
title: Mitochondria Structure
description: Double-membrane bound organelle. Inner membrane folds into Cristae to increase surface area for ATP production (Oxidative Phosphorylation).
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 300 150' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><ellipse cx='150' cy='75' rx='140' ry='65' fill='#D1FAE5' stroke='#059669' stroke-width='3'/><path d='M30,75 Q50,40 70,75 T110,75 T150,75 T190,75 T230,75 T270,75' fill='none' stroke='#10B981' stroke-width='4' stroke-dasharray='5,5'/><text x='140' y='100' font-family='Arial' font-size='10' fill='#065F46'>Matrix</text><text x='50' y='50' font-family='Arial' font-size='10' fill='#065F46'>Cristae</text><circle cx='80' cy='90' r='3' fill='#F59E0B' /><circle cx='120' cy='60' r='3' fill='#F59E0B' /><circle cx='200' cy='100' r='3' fill='#F59E0B' /><text x='240' y='120' font-family='Arial' font-size='10' fill='#F59E0B'>ATP Synthase</text></svg>

subject: Biology
title: Central Dogma
description: The flow of genetic information: DNA replication -> Transcription to mRNA -> Translation to Protein. Proposed by Francis Crick.
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 350 100' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><defs><marker id='arrow_cd' markerWidth='10' markerHeight='10' refX='0' refY='3' orient='auto'><path d='M0,0 L0,6 L9,3 z' fill='#6B7280' /></marker></defs><rect x='10' y='30' width='80' height='40' rx='10' fill='#E0E7FF' stroke='#4F46E5' stroke-width='2'/><text x='50' y='55' text-anchor='middle' font-family='Arial' font-size='14' fill='#312E81'>DNA</text><rect x='135' y='30' width='80' height='40' rx='10' fill='#D1FAE5' stroke='#059669' stroke-width='2'/><text x='175' y='55' text-anchor='middle' font-family='Arial' font-size='14' fill='#064E3B'>RNA</text><rect x='260' y='30' width='80' height='40' rx='10' fill='#FEF3C7' stroke='#D97706' stroke-width='2'/><text x='300' y='55' text-anchor='middle' font-family='Arial' font-size='14' fill='#78350F'>Protein</text><line x1='90' y1='50' x2='125' y2='50' stroke='#6B7280' stroke-width='2' marker-end='url(#arrow_cd)' /><line x1='215' y1='50' x2='250' y2='50' stroke='#6B7280' stroke-width='2' marker-end='url(#arrow_cd)' /><text x='108' y='25' text-anchor='middle' font-size='10' fill='#6B7280'>Transcription</text><text x='233' y='25' text-anchor='middle' font-size='10' fill='#6B7280'>Translation</text><path d='M50,30 C20,10 80,10 50,30' fill='none' stroke='#4F46E5' stroke-width='2' marker-end='url(#arrow_cd)'/><text x='50' y='10' text-anchor='middle' font-size='9' fill='#4F46E5'>Replication</text></svg>

subject: Biology
title: Cell Cycle Phases
description: Interphase occupies 95% of the duration (G1, S, G2). M-Phase (Mitosis) is the actual division phase.
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 200 200' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><circle cx='100' cy='100' r='90' fill='#F3F4F6' /><path d='M100,100 L100,10 A90,90 0 0,1 190,100 z' fill='#93C5FD' /><text x='130' y='60' font-size='14' font-weight='bold' fill='#1E3A8A'>G1</text><path d='M100,100 L190,100 A90,90 0 0,1 100,190 z' fill='#FCA5A5' /><text x='130' y='140' font-size='14' font-weight='bold' fill='#7F1D1D'>S</text><path d='M100,100 L100,190 A90,90 0 0,1 30,160 z' fill='#A7F3D0' /><text x='70' y='160' font-size='14' font-weight='bold' fill='#064E3B'>G2</text><path d='M100,100 L30,160 A90,90 0 0,1 100,10 z' fill='#FDE68A' /><text x='60' y='80' font-size='14' font-weight='bold' fill='#92400E'>M</text></svg>

subject: Biology
title: Human Heart Flow
description: Double circulation pathway: Right Atrium -> Right Ventricle -> Lungs (Pulmonary) -> Left Atrium -> Left Ventricle -> Body (Systemic).
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 200 200' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><path d='M100,180 C40,130 20,80 50,40 A30,30 0 0,1 100,60 A30,30 0 0,1 150,40 C180,80 160,130 100,180 Z' fill='#FEE2E2' stroke='#EF4444' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='100' y1='60' x2='100' y2='160' stroke='#EF4444' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='30' y1='90' x2='170' y2='90' stroke='#EF4444' stroke-width='2'/><text x='60' y='80' font-size='10' fill='#991B1B'>RA</text><text x='130' y='80' font-size='10' fill='#991B1B'>LA</text><text x='60' y='130' font-size='10' fill='#991B1B'>RV</text><text x='130' y='130' font-size='10' fill='#991B1B'>LV</text><path d='M40,50 L40,110' stroke='#3B82F6' stroke-width='2' stroke-dasharray='4,2'/><path d='M160,50 L160,110' stroke='#EF4444' stroke-width='2'/></svg>

subject: Biology
title: Nephron Structure
description: Functional unit of kidney. Filtration (Glomerulus) -> Reabsorption (PCT) -> Concentration (Loop of Henle) -> Secretion (DCT) -> Collection.
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 300 150' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><circle cx='30' cy='50' r='20' fill='none' stroke='#F59E0B' stroke-width='2'/><path d='M50,50 Q80,20 100,50' fill='none' stroke='#F59E0B' stroke-width='3'/><path d='M100,50 L100,120 Q120,140 140,120 L140,50' fill='none' stroke='#F59E0B' stroke-width='3'/><path d='M140,50 Q160,20 190,50' fill='none' stroke='#F59E0B' stroke-width='3'/><line x1='190' y1='30' x2='190' y2='140' stroke='#F59E0B' stroke-width='4'/><text x='10' y='20' font-size='10'>Glomerulus</text><text x='60' y='30' font-size='10'>PCT</text><text x='100' y='145' font-size='10'>Henle Loop</text><text x='160' y='30' font-size='10'>DCT</text></svg>

subject: Biology
title: Sarcomere (Muscle)
description: Contractile unit. Z-line to Z-line. A-band (Dark, Myosin+Actin), I-band (Light, Actin only), H-zone (Myosin only).
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 300 100' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><line x1='10' y1='10' x2='10' y2='90' stroke='#000' stroke-width='4'/><line x1='290' y1='10' x2='290' y2='90' stroke='#000' stroke-width='4'/><line x1='10' y1='30' x2='100' y2='30' stroke='#3B82F6' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='10' y1='70' x2='100' y2='70' stroke='#3B82F6' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='200' y1='30' x2='290' y2='30' stroke='#3B82F6' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='200' y1='70' x2='290' y2='70' stroke='#3B82F6' stroke-width='2'/><rect x='80' y='40' width='140' height='20' fill='#EF4444'/><text x='150' y='95' text-anchor='middle' font-size='10'>A-Band</text><text x='50' y='95' text-anchor='middle' font-size='10'>I-Band</text><text x='150' y='20' text-anchor='middle' font-size='10'>H-Zone</text></svg>

subject: Biology
title: Calvin Cycle (C3)
description: 1. Carboxylation (RuBP + CO2 -> 3-PGA). 2. Reduction (ATP+NADPH used). 3. Regeneration of RuBP (ATP used).
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 200 200' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><circle cx='100' cy='100' r='80' fill='none' stroke='#10B981' stroke-width='2'/><text x='100' y='30' text-anchor='middle' font-size='12' fill='#065F46'>Carboxylation</text><text x='170' y='120' text-anchor='middle' font-size='12' fill='#065F46'>Reduction</text><text x='30' y='120' text-anchor='middle' font-size='12' fill='#065F46'>Regeneration</text><text x='100' y='60' text-anchor='middle' font-size='10'>RuBP + CO2</text><text x='140' y='150' text-anchor='middle' font-size='10'>Triose Phosphate</text><path d='M100,40 L160,100 L100,160 L40,100 Z' fill='none' stroke='#10B981' stroke-dasharray='4,4'/></svg>

subject: Biology
title: Nerve Impulse
description: Resting Potential (-70mV, Na+/K+ pump). Depolarization (Na+ influx). Repolarization (K+ efflux).
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 300 100' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><line x1='10' y1='80' x2='290' y2='80' stroke='#6B7280'/><line x1='30' y1='10' x2='30' y2='90' stroke='#6B7280'/><path d='M30,70 L80,70 L100,10 L120,90 L150,70 L280,70' fill='none' stroke='#8B5CF6' stroke-width='2'/><text x='40' y='65' font-size='10'>-70mV</text><text x='105' y='25' font-size='10'>+30mV</text><text x='100' y='98' font-size='10' text-anchor='middle'>Action Potential</text></svg>

subject: Biology
title: Oxygen Dissociation Curve
description: Sigmoid curve. Right Shift (Bohr Effect): High pCO2, High H+, High Temp (Tissues). Left Shift: Low pCO2, Low Temp (Alveoli).
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 200 150' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><line x1='20' y1='130' x2='180' y2='130' stroke='#000'/><line x1='20' y1='10' x2='20' y2='130' stroke='#000'/><path d='M20,130 Q60,130 80,80 T180,20' fill='none' stroke='#EF4444' stroke-width='2'/><text x='100' y='145' font-size='10'>pO2 (mmHg)</text><text x='5' y='70' font-size='10' transform='rotate(-90 5,70)'>% Saturation</text></svg>

subject: Biology
title: Double Fertilization
description: 1. Syngamy: Male gamete (n) + Egg (n) -> Zygote (2n). 2. Triple Fusion: Male gamete (n) + Polar nuclei (2n) -> PEN (3n).
visual_data: \text{Syngamy} \to \text{Zygote (2n)} \\ \text{Triple Fusion} \to \text{Endosperm (3n)}

subject: Biology
title: Lac Operon
description: Inducible operon. In absence of lactose, Repressor binds Operator. In presence, Inducer (Lactose) binds Repressor, allowing Transcription.
visual_data: i \xrightarrow{\text{Repressor}} O \xrightarrow{\text{Blocked}} z,y,a \\ \text{Lactose} + \text{Repressor} \to \text{Inactive}

subject: Biology
title: PCR Cycles
description: Polymerase Chain Reaction. 1. Denaturation (94C). 2. Annealing (54C). 3. Extension (72C, Taq Polymerase). Amplifies DNA 1 billion times in 30 cycles.
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 300 100' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect x='10' y='30' width='80' height='40' rx='5' fill='#FECACA' stroke='#EF4444'/><text x='50' y='55' text-anchor='middle' font-size='10'>Denaturation</text><rect x='110' y='30' width='80' height='40' rx='5' fill='#BFDBFE' stroke='#3B82F6'/><text x='150' y='55' text-anchor='middle' font-size='10'>Annealing</text><rect x='210' y='30' width='80' height='40' rx='5' fill='#A7F3D0' stroke='#10B981'/><text x='250' y='55' text-anchor='middle' font-size='10'>Extension</text><path d='M90,50 L110,50' stroke='#000'/><path d='M190,50 L210,50' stroke='#000'/></svg>

subject: Biology
title: Five Kingdom System
description: R.H. Whittaker (1969). Monera (Prokaryote), Protista (Unicellular Eukaryote), Fungi (Chitin wall), Plantae (Cellulose), Animalia (No wall).
visual_data: \text{Monera} \to \text{Protista} \to \text{Fungi, Plantae, Animalia}

subject: Biology
title: Root Modifications
description: Storage (Carrot - Conical, Radish - Fusiform). Support (Banyan - Prop, Maize - Stilt). Respiration (Rhizophora - Pneumatophores).
visual_data: \text{Fusiform} \to \text{Radish} \\ \text{Napiform} \to \text{Turnip} \\ \text{Pneumatophore} \to \text{Oxygen}

subject: Biology
title: Ribosome Subunits
description: Prokaryotes (70S = 50S + 30S). Eukaryotes (80S = 60S + 40S). 'S' is Svedberg Unit (Sedimentation coefficient).
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 200 150' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><ellipse cx='100' cy='100' rx='60' ry='30' fill='#E5E7EB' stroke='#9CA3AF'/><ellipse cx='100' cy='60' rx='40' ry='25' fill='#D1D5DB' stroke='#6B7280'/><text x='100' y='70' text-anchor='middle' font-size='12'>Large</text><text x='100' y='110' text-anchor='middle' font-size='12'>Small</text></svg>

subject: Biology
title: ART Techniques
description: Assisted Reproductive Technologies. IVF (In Vitro), ET (Embryo Transfer).
visual_data: \text{ZIFT} \to \text{Zygote (Fallopian)} \\ \text{IUT} \to \text{Embryo (Uterus)} \\ \text{GIFT} \to \text{Gamete (Fallopian)}

subject: Biology
title: Homologous Organs
description: Same origin, different function. Evidence of Divergent Evolution.
visual_data: \text{Forelimbs: } \text{Whale, Bat, Cheetah, Human} \\ \text{Thorns (Bougainvillea) & Tendrils (Cucurbita)}

subject: Biology
title: Linkage (Morgan)
description: Physical association of genes on same chromosome. Inversely proportional to distance.
visual_data: \text{Linkage} \propto \frac{1}{\text{Distance between genes}} \\ 1\% \text{ Recomb.} = 1 \text{ cM (Map Unit)}

subject: Biology
title: Antibody Structure (IgG)
description: Y-shaped protein. H2L2 (2 Heavy chains, 2 Light chains). Disulfide bonds connect chains. Antigen binding site at tips (Variable region).
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 200 200' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><path d='M80,50 L80,180' stroke='#3B82F6' stroke-width='6' fill='none' /><path d='M120,50 L120,180' stroke='#3B82F6' stroke-width='6' fill='none' /><path d='M80,100 L120,100' stroke='#EF4444' stroke-width='3' /> <path d='M80,100 L40,40' stroke='#3B82F6' stroke-width='6' /><path d='M120,100 L160,40' stroke='#3B82F6' stroke-width='6' /><path d='M50,40 L90,100' stroke='#10B981' stroke-width='4' /><path d='M150,40 L110,100' stroke='#10B981' stroke-width='4' /><text x='20' y='30' font-size='10' fill='#10B981'>Light</text><text x='170' y='180' font-size='10' fill='#3B82F6'>Heavy</text><text x='100' y='190' font-size='10' text-anchor='middle'>Fc Region</text></svg>

subject: Biology
title: pBR322 Plasmid Vector
description: E. coli cloning vector. ori (Origin), rop (Replication protein), ampR (Ampicillin resistance), tetR (Tetracycline resistance). Restriction sites: EcoRI, BamHI.
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 200 200' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><circle cx='100' cy='100' r='80' fill='none' stroke='#6B7280' stroke-width='4'/><path d='M100,20 A80,80 0 0,1 180,100' fill='none' stroke='#EF4444' stroke-width='8'/><text x='150' y='50' font-size='12' fill='#EF4444'>ampR</text><path d='M180,100 A80,80 0 0,1 100,180' fill='none' stroke='#3B82F6' stroke-width='8'/><text x='150' y='150' font-size='12' fill='#3B82F6'>tetR</text><line x1='100' y1='20' x2='100' y2='5' stroke='#000'/><text x='100' y='15' text-anchor='middle' font-size='10'>EcoRI</text><line x1='180' y1='100' x2='195' y2='100' stroke='#000'/><text x='200' y='105' font-size='10'>BamHI</text><text x='60' y='100' text-anchor='middle' font-size='12' fill='#10B981'>ori</text></svg>

subject: Biology
title: Restriction Site (EcoRI)
description: Palindromic sequence cut by EcoRI enzyme. Produces sticky ends.
visual_data: 5' - G \downarrow AATTC - 3' \\ 3' - CTTAA \uparrow G - 5'

subject: Biology
title: HIV Replication
description: Retrovirus. RNA genome -> Reverse Transcription (Viral DNA) -> Integration into Host Genome -> Transcription -> New Viral RNA.
visual_data: \text{Viral RNA} \xrightarrow{\text{Rev. Trans.}} \text{Viral DNA} \xrightarrow{\text{Integrase}} \text{Host DNA}

subject: Biology
title: Drug Sources
description: Opioids (Poppy - Papaver somniferum), Cannabinoids (Cannabis sativa), Coca alkaloid (Erythroxylum coca).
visual_data: \text{Morphine} \to \text{Latex of Poppy} \\ \text{Cocaine} \to \text{Coca Plant (S. America)}

subject: Biology
title: Pyramid of Numbers
description: Upright in Grassland (Producer > Herbivore > Carnivore). Inverted in Tree ecosystem (Tree < Birds < Parasites).
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 200 200' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><polygon points='100,20 180,180 20,180' fill='#D1FAE5' stroke='#10B981'/><line x1='35' y1='150' x2='165' y2='150' stroke='#10B981'/><line x1='50' y1='120' x2='150' y2='120' stroke='#10B981'/><text x='100' y='170' text-anchor='middle' font-size='10'>Producers</text><text x='100' y='140' text-anchor='middle' font-size='10'>Pri. Cons.</text><text x='100' y='110' text-anchor='middle' font-size='10'>Sec. Cons.</text></svg>

subject: Biology
title: Pyramid of Biomass
description: Usually Upright. Inverted in Aquatic ecosystem (Phytoplankton mass < Zooplankton mass).
visual_data: \text{Aquatic: Inverted (PC < SC)} \\ \text{Terrestrial: Upright}

subject: Biology
title: Biomagnification
description: Increase in concentration of toxicant (DDT/Mercury) at successive trophic levels.
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 200 200' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect x='20' y='160' width='160' height='30' fill='#BFDBFE'/><text x='100' y='180' text-anchor='middle' font-size='10'>Water (0.003 ppb)</text><circle cx='100' cy='130' r='15' fill='#FCA5A5'/><text x='140' y='135' font-size='10'>Zoo (0.04 ppm)</text><ellipse cx='100' cy='90' rx='25' ry='15' fill='#F87171'/><text x='150' y='95' font-size='10'>Fish (0.5 ppm)</text><path d='M80,50 L120,50 L100,20 Z' fill='#EF4444'/><text x='150' y='40' font-size='10'>Bird (25 ppm)</text><line x1='100' y1='160' x2='100' y2='60' stroke='#000' stroke-width='2' marker-end='url(#arrow)'/></svg>

subject: Biology
title: Biodiversity Hotspots
description: High species richness and high endemism. 34 globally. India: Western Ghats, Himalayas, Indo-Burma.
visual_data: \begin{array}{l} \text{Criteria:} \\ 1.~>1500~\text{endemic plants} \\ 2.~>70\%~\text{habitat loss} \end{array}

subject: Biology
title: Species-Area Curve (Log)
description: Linear on log-log scale. Steeper slope (Z) for larger areas (continents).
visual_data: \log S = \log C + Z \log A

subject: Biology
title: Menstrual Cycle (Hormones)
description: Day 14: LH Surge (Ovulation). Follicular Phase (Estrogen high). Luteal Phase (Progesterone high, maintains Endometrium).
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 300 150' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><line x1='30' y1='10' x2='30' y2='130' stroke='#E5E7EB'/><line x1='30' y1='130' x2='290' y2='130' stroke='#6B7280'/><text x='150' y='145' font-size='10' text-anchor='middle'>Day 14 (Ovulation)</text><path d='M30,120 Q100,120 150,20 Q200,120 290,120' fill='none' stroke='#EF4444' stroke-width='2'/><text x='160' y='20' font-size='10' fill='#EF4444'>LH Surge</text><path d='M30,100 Q100,40 140,80 Q200,100 290,100' fill='none' stroke='#3B82F6' stroke-width='2' stroke-dasharray='4,2'/><text x='80' y='60' font-size='10' fill='#3B82F6'>Estrogen</text><path d='M30,125 L150,125 Q200,40 250,125' fill='none' stroke='#10B981' stroke-width='2'/><text x='210' y='50' font-size='10' fill='#10B981'>Progesterone</text></svg>

subject: Biology
title: Synaptic Transmission
description: Electrical signal reaches Axon Terminal -> Ca++ influx -> Vesicles fuse -> Neurotransmitter (Ach) released into Cleft -> Binds to Receptors.
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 200 200' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><path d='M60,10 L60,100 Q60,140 100,140 Q140,140 140,100 L140,10' fill='#BFDBFE' stroke='#3B82F6' stroke-width='3'/><circle cx='100' cy='100' r='10' fill='#EF4444'/><circle cx='80' cy='80' r='8' fill='#EF4444'/><rect x='40' y='160' width='120' height='30' rx='5' fill='#A7F3D0' stroke='#10B981' stroke-width='3'/><path d='M80,160 L90,160 L85,150 Z' fill='#059669'/><path d='M110,160 L120,160 L115,150 Z' fill='#059669'/><circle cx='100' cy='150' r='3' fill='#EF4444'/><circle cx='85' cy='145' r='3' fill='#EF4444'/><circle cx='115' cy='145' r='3' fill='#EF4444'/><text x='150' y='100' font-size='10' fill='#3B82F6'>Axon Terminal</text><text x='170' y='170' font-size='10' fill='#10B981'>Dendrite</text></svg>

subject: Biology
title: C4 Pathway (Hatch & Slack)
description: Kranz Anatomy. Mesophyll: PEPCase fixes CO2 -> OAA (C4). Bundle Sheath: Decarboxylation releases CO2 for RuBisCO (C3 cycle). No Photorespiration.
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 250 150' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><defs><marker id='arrow' markerWidth='10' markerHeight='10' refX='0' refY='3' orient='auto'><path d='M0,0 L0,6 L9,3 z' fill='#6B7280' /></marker></defs><rect x='10' y='10' width='100' height='130' rx='10' fill='#D1FAE5' stroke='#10B981'/><text x='60' y='30' text-anchor='middle' font-size='12' font-weight='bold'>Mesophyll</text><text x='60' y='70' text-anchor='middle' font-size='10'>PEP + CO2</text><text x='60' y='100' text-anchor='middle' font-size='10' fill='#EF4444'>OAA (C4)</text><rect x='140' y='10' width='100' height='130' rx='10' fill='#FEF3C7' stroke='#F59E0B'/><text x='190' y='30' text-anchor='middle' font-size='12' font-weight='bold'>Bundle Sheath</text><text x='190' y='70' text-anchor='middle' font-size='10'>Malic Acid</text><text x='190' y='100' text-anchor='middle' font-size='10' fill='#EF4444'>RuBisCO (C3)</text><path d='M110,80 L140,80' stroke='#6B7280' stroke-width='2' marker-end='url(#arrow)'/></svg>

subject: Biology
title: Gel Electrophoresis
description: Separation of DNA fragments by size. DNA is negative (moves to Anode +). Smaller fragments move faster/further.
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 200 150' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect x='40' y='20' width='120' height='110' fill='#E0F2FE' stroke='#3B82F6' stroke-width='2'/><rect x='50' y='25' width='20' height='10' fill='#1E3A8A'/><rect x='80' y='25' width='20' height='10' fill='#1E3A8A'/><rect x='110' y='25' width='20' height='10' fill='#1E3A8A'/><rect x='50' y='50' width='20' height='5' fill='#F97316'/><rect x='80' y='60' width='20' height='5' fill='#F97316'/><rect x='80' y='90' width='20' height='5' fill='#F97316'/><rect x='110' y='110' width='20' height='5' fill='#F97316'/><text x='20' y='30' font-size='12' font-weight='bold'>-</text><text x='20' y='130' font-size='12' font-weight='bold'>+</text><text x='165' y='40' font-size='10'>Large DNA</text><text x='165' y='120' font-size='10'>Small DNA</text></svg>

subject: Biology
title: Glycolysis (EMP Pathway)
description: Occurs in Cytoplasm. Anaerobic. 1 Glucose (6C) -> 2 Pyruvate (3C). Net gain: 2 ATP + 2 NADH.
visual_data: \text{Glucose} \xrightarrow{\text{Hexokinase}} \text{G-6-P} \to \text{F-6-P} \\ \xrightarrow{\text{PFK}} \text{F-1,6-BP} \to \text{2 Pyruvate}

subject: Biology
title: Chromosomal Disorders
description: Aneuploidy (Non-disjunction). Down's (Trisomy 21). Klinefelter's (XXY - Sterile male). Turner's (XO - Sterile female).
visual_data:
Down's Syndrome: 47, XX, +21
Klinefelter's: 47, XXY (Gynecomastia)
Turner's: 45, XO (Rudimentary Ovaries)

subject: Biology
title: Thyroid Hormones
description: T3, T4 (Thyroxine) - regulate BMR (Basal Metabolic Rate). TCT (Thyrocalcitonin) - lowers blood calcium. Iodine essential.
visual_data: \text{Hypothyroid} \to \text{Goitre / Cretinism} \\ \text{Hyperthyroid} \to \text{Graves' Disease}

subject: Biology
title: Spermatogenesis vs Oogenesis
description: Comparison of gamete formation. Spermatogenesis is continuous from puberty. Oogenesis halts at Prophase-I and Metaphase-II.
visual_data: \text{Sperm:} \; 1 \text{ SMC} \to 4 \text{ Sperms} \\ \text{Ovum:} \; 1 \text{ OMC} \to 1 \text{ Ovum} + 2-3 \text{ Polar Bodies}

subject: Biology
title: Hardy-Weinberg Factors
description: 5 Factors affecting equilibrium: Gene Migration, Genetic Drift (Founder/Bottleneck), Mutation, Recombination, Natural Selection.
visual_data:
Equilibrium: p^2 + 2pq + q^2 = 1

Disrupted by:
1. Gene Flow
2. Genetic Drift
3. Mutation
4. Recombination
5. Natural Selection

subject: Biology
title: Water Potential
description: \(\Psi_w = \Psi_s + \Psi_p\). Water moves from High \(\Psi_w\) (less negative) to Low \(\Psi_w\) (more negative).
visual_data: \Psi_w = \Psi_s + \Psi_p \\ \Psi_s \text{ is always negative}

subject: Biology
title: Stomatal Apparatus
description: Regulates transpiration and gas exchange. Guard cells (Bean-shaped in Dicots, Dumbbell in Monocots) control opening/closing via Turgor pressure.
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 200 150' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><path d='M60,20 Q100,5 140,20 Q130,75 140,130 Q100,145 60,130 Q70,75 60,20' fill='#D1FAE5' stroke='#10B981' stroke-width='3'/><ellipse cx='100' cy='75' rx='15' ry='40' fill='#064E3B'/><circle cx='75' cy='40' r='3' fill='#10B981'/><circle cx='75' cy='60' r='3' fill='#10B981'/><circle cx='75' cy='80' r='3' fill='#10B981'/><circle cx='125' cy='40' r='3' fill='#10B981'/><circle cx='125' cy='60' r='3' fill='#10B981'/><circle cx='125' cy='80' r='3' fill='#10B981'/><text x='100' y='145' text-anchor='middle' font-size='10' fill='#065F46'>Stomatal Pore</text><text x='20' y='75' font-size='10' fill='#10B981'>Guard Cell</text></svg>

subject: Biology
title: tRNA Structure (Clover Leaf)
description: Adapter molecule. Anticodon loop reads mRNA. Acceptor arm (3' end) binds Amino Acid. D-loop and T-loop for stability.
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 200 200' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><path d='M100,20 L100,60 Q60,60 40,80 Q20,100 40,120 Q60,140 80,120 L90,140 Q80,180 100,190 Q120,180 110,140 L120,120 Q140,140 160,120 Q180,100 160,80 Q140,60 110,60 L110,20' fill='none' stroke='#8B5CF6' stroke-width='4'/><circle cx='100' cy='190' r='5' fill='#F59E0B'/><text x='130' y='190' font-size='10' fill='#F59E0B'>Anticodon</text><rect x='90' y='10' width='30' height='10' fill='#EF4444'/><text x='130' y='20' font-size='10' fill='#EF4444'>AA Binding (3')</text><text x='20' y='100' font-size='10' fill='#8B5CF6'>D-Loop</text><text x='165' y='100' font-size='10' fill='#8B5CF6'>T-Loop</text></svg>

subject: Biology
title: Co-dominance (Blood Groups)
description: Both alleles express themselves fully in heterozygotes. Example: ABO Blood Grouping (IA and IB are co-dominant).
visual_data: I^A I^B \to \text{Group AB} \\ I^A i \to \text{Group A} \\ ii \to \text{Group O}

subject: Biology
title: Nitrogen Cycle Steps
description: 1. Fixation (N2 -> NH3). 2. Nitrification (NH3 -> NO2- -> NO3-). 3. Assimilation (Plants). 4. Ammonification (Dead -> NH3). 5. Denitrification (NO3- -> N2).
visual_data:
Fixation: Rhizobium / Azotobacter
Nitrification: Nitrosomonas / Nitrobacter
Denitrification: Pseudomonas

subject: Biology
title: Active vs Passive Immunity
description: Active: Body makes antibodies (Vaccine/Infection, Slow, Long-lasting). Passive: Ready-made antibodies (Colostrum IgA, Anti-venom, Fast, Short-lived).
visual_data:
Active: Vaccine, Infection (Memory present)
Passive: Colostrum, Tetanus shot (No Memory)

subject: Biology
title: Prophase I Stages
description: Leptotene (Condensation), Zygotene (Synapsis/Bivalent), Pachytene (Crossing Over/Recombination), Diplotene (Chiasmata), Diakinesis (Terminalization).
visual_data:
LZPDD Mnemonic:
Lazy (Leptotene)
Zebra (Zygotene)
Pushes (Pachytene)
Dumb (Diplotene)
Donkey (Diakinesis)

subject: Biology
title: Population Interactions
description: Mutualism (+/+), Competition (-/-), Predation (+/-), Parasitism (+/-), Commensalism (+/0), Amensalism (-/0).
visual_data: \text{Lichen: Algae + Fungi (+/+)} \\ \text{Orchid on Mango: (+/0)}

subject: Biology
title: Z-Scheme (Light Reaction)
description: Non-cyclic photophosphorylation. PS-II (680nm) -> Plastoquinone -> Cytochrome -> PS-I (700nm) -> Ferredoxin -> NADP+.
visual_data: H_2O \to \text{PS-II} \to \text{ETS} \to \text{PS-I} \to \text{NADPH}

subject: Biology
title: Aestivation Types
description: Arrangement of sepals/petals. Valvate (Calotropis), Twisted (Cotton), Imbricate (Cassia), Vexillary (Pea/Bean).
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 200 80' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><circle cx='30' cy='40' r='20' fill='none' stroke='#EF4444' stroke-width='2' stroke-dasharray='10,5'/><text x='30' y='75' font-size='8' text-anchor='middle'>Valvate</text><path d='M70,20 L90,20 L90,40' fill='none' stroke='#3B82F6' stroke-width='2'/><text x='80' y='75' font-size='8' text-anchor='middle'>Twisted</text><path d='M130,20 Q150,5 170,20' fill='none' stroke='#10B981' stroke-width='2'/><path d='M135,40 Q150,60 165,40' fill='none' stroke='#10B981' stroke-width='2'/><text x='150' y='75' font-size='8' text-anchor='middle'>Vexillary</text></svg>

subject: Biology
title: Epithelial Tissue Types
description: Squamous (Diffusion - Lungs), Cuboidal (Secretion - Ducts), Columnar (Absorption - Intestine), Ciliated (Movement - Bronchioles).
visual_data: \text{Squamous} \to \text{Flat (Tiles)} \\ \text{Cuboidal} \to \text{Cube-like} \\ \text{Columnar} \to \text{Tall/Pillar}

subject: Biology
title: Biogas Plant Structure
description: Methanogens (Methanobacterium) produce Biogas (CH4 + CO2) from dung/slurry under anaerobic conditions.

subject: Biology
title: Vaccination Types
description: Live Attenuated (MMR, OPV). Killed/Inactivated (Rabies, IPV). Toxoid (Tetanus, Diphtheria). Subunit (Hepatitis B - Yeast derived).
visual_data:
Live: Polio (Oral), BCG
Killed: Polio (Injectable), Cholera
Toxoid: Tetanus
Recombinant: Hep-B

subject: Biology
title: Analogous Organs
description: Different origin, Same function. Evidence of Convergent Evolution. Wings of Butterfly vs Bat. Eye of Octopus vs Mammal.
visual_data: \text{Wings: Insect vs Bird} \\ \text{Eye: Octopus vs Mammal} \\ \text{Sweet Potato (Root) vs Potato (Stem)}

subject: Biology
title: Pancreatic Hormones
description: Islets of Langerhans. Alpha cells -> Glucagon (Hyperglycemic). Beta cells -> Insulin (Hypoglycemic).
visual_data: \text{Glucagon} \uparrow \text{Blood Glucose} \\ \text{Insulin} \downarrow \text{Blood Glucose} \to \text{Glycogen}

subject: Biology
title: Infertility Treatments
description: ZIFT (Zygote -> Fallopian). IUT (Embryo > 8 cells -> Uterus). GIFT (Gamete -> Fallopian). ICSI (Sperm injected into Ovum).
visual_data:
ZIFT: Zygote to Fallopian
IUT: Embryo (>8 blastomeres) to Uterus
GIFT: Gamete transfer (requires functional tube)
ICSI: Intra Cytoplasmic Sperm Injection

subject: Biology
title: Ecological Succession (Xerarch)
description: Succession on bare rock. Lichen (Pioneer) -> Bryophytes -> Herbs -> Shrubs -> Forest (Climax).
visual_data: \text{Crustose Lichen} \to \text{Foliose Lichen} \\ \to \text{Moss} \to \text{Herbs} \to \text{Shrubs} \to \text{Trees}

subject: Biology
title: Genetic Mapping
description: Alfred Sturtevant. Distance between genes is proportional to recombination frequency. 1% Recombination = 1 map unit (cM).
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 200 60' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><line x1='20' y1='30' x2='180' y2='30' stroke='#6B7280' stroke-width='4'/><circle cx='40' cy='30' r='5' fill='#EF4444'/><text x='40' y='50' text-anchor='middle' font-size='10'>Gene A</text><circle cx='100' cy='30' r='5' fill='#3B82F6'/><text x='100' y='50' text-anchor='middle' font-size='10'>Gene B</text><circle cx='160' cy='30' r='5' fill='#10B981'/><text x='160' y='50' text-anchor='middle' font-size='10'>Gene C</text><text x='70' y='20' text-anchor='middle' font-size='10'>6 cM</text><text x='130' y='20' text-anchor='middle' font-size='10'>12 cM</text></svg>

subject: Biology
title: Placentation Types
description: Arrangement of ovules. Marginal (Pea), Axile (Lemon, Tomato), Parietal (Mustard), Free Central (Dianthus), Basal (Sunflower).
visual_data:
Marginal: Ridge (Pea)
Axile: Central Axis (Tomato)
Parietal: Inner Wall (Mustard)
Basal: Base (Sunflower)

subject: Biology
title: Mitosis Stages
description: Prophase (Condensation). Metaphase (Equatorial Plate). Anaphase (Centromere splits, Chromatids move). Telophase (Decondensation).
visual_data: \text{Metaphase:} \; \text{Chromosomes at Equator} \\ \text{Anaphase:} \; \text{Sister Chromatids Separate}

subject: Biology
title: Sigmoid Growth Curve
description: Lag Phase (Slow), Log/Exponential Phase (Rapid), Stationary Phase (Limited resources).

subject: Biology
title: Electrocardiogram (ECG)
description: P-Wave (Atrial Depolarization). QRS Complex (Ventricular Depolarization). T-Wave (Ventricular Repolarization). Count QRS to get Heart Rate.

subject: Biology
title: Replication Fork
description: Occurs in 5' to 3' direction. Leading Strand (Continuous). Lagging Strand (Discontinuous - Okazaki Fragments). Ligase joins fragments.

title: Insulin Maturation
description: Pro-insulin contains A, B, and C peptide chains. Mature Insulin has only A and B chains linked by Disulfide bridges (C-peptide removed).

title: Age Pyramids
description: Shape indicates population growth. Triangular = Expanding (Young > Old). Bell = Stable (Young = Old). Urn = Declining (Young < Old).

title: Transcription Unit
description: Promoter (binding site for RNA Pol), Structural Gene (transcribed), Terminator. Template Strand (3'->5'). Coding Strand (5'->3').

subject: Biology
title: Root Nodule Formation
description: Rhizobium multiplies -> Root hair curls -> Infection thread carries bacteria to cortex -> Cells divide -> Nodule formed. Leghaemoglobin creates anaerobic condition.
visual_data:
1. Rhizobium colonization
2. Curling of Root Hair
3. Infection Thread formation
4. Bacteria released into cortex
5. Differentiation into Bacteroids
6. Nitrogenase enzyme activation

subject: Biology
title: Cell Cycle Checkpoints
description: Control mechanisms. G1/S (Restriction Point) - checks DNA damage. G2/M - checks DNA replication. M (Spindle) - checks chromosome attachment.
visual_data:
G1/S: Decision to divide (Start)
G2/M: DNA Replication complete?
M: Metaphase alignment correct?

subject: Biology
title: Pedigree Analysis Symbols

subject: Biology
title: Ozone Depletion
description: Good Ozone (Stratosphere) protects from UV-B. Bad Ozone (Troposphere). Thickness measured in Dobson Units (DU). CFCs release Cl atoms which degrade Ozone.
visual_data: CF_2Cl_2 \xrightarrow{UV} Cl \bullet \\ Cl \bullet + O_3 \to ClO + O_2

subject: Biology
title: Inflorescence Types
description: Racemose: Main axis continues growth, flowers acropetal (bottom-old, top-young). Cymose: Main axis terminates in flower, basipetal order.
visual_data: \text{Racemose} \to \text{Unlimited Growth} \\ \text{Cymose} \to \text{Limited Growth (Terminates)}

subject: Biology
title: Malaria Lifecycle
description: Infective stage: Sporozoites (Mosquito bite). Liver: Asexual reproduction. RBCs: Rupture releases Haemozoin (Fever/Chills). Gametocytes formed in Human, fertilization in Mosquito gut.
