subject: Biology
title: Plant Hormones Functions
description: Auxin (Apical Dominance, Rooting). Gibberellin (Bolting, Internode elongation). Cytokinin (Cell division, Delay senescence). Ethylene (Ripening). ABA (Stress hormone, Stomata closure).
visual_data:
Auxin: Apical Dominance
Gibberellin: 'Bolting' (Sugarcane)
Cytokinin: Cell Division
Ethylene: Fruit Ripening
ABA: Stress / Dormancy

subject: Biology
title: DNA Fingerprinting
description: Alec Jeffreys. Uses Satellite DNA (VNTRs - Variable Number Tandem Repeats). Steps: Isolation -> Digestion -> Electrophoresis -> Blotting -> Probe Hybridization.
visual_data:
VNTR: Mini-satellite DNA
Sensitivity: PCR increases sample
Blotting: Southern Blot (Nitrocellulose)

subject: Biology
title: Krebs Cycle (TCA)
description: Matrix of Mitochondria. Acetyl CoA (2C) + OAA (4C) -> Citrate (6C). Decarboxylation releases 2 CO2. Yields: 3 NADH, 1 FADH2, 1 GTP per cycle.
visual_data: \text{Citrate} \to \alpha\text{-Ketoglutarate} \to \text{Succinate} \\ \to \text{Malate} \to \text{Oxaloacetate}

subject: Biology
title: Anaphase I vs Anaphase II
description: Anaphase I: Homologous chromosomes separate (Segregation), Centromere does NOT split. Anaphase II: Centromere splits, Sister chromatids separate.
visual_data: \text{Ana I: 2n} \to \text{n (Reduction)} \\ \text{Ana II: n} \to \text{n (Equational)}

subject: Biology
title: Population Growth Models
description: Exponential: dN/dt = rN (Unlimited resources). Logistic: dN/dt = rN((K-N)/K) (Limited resources, Carrying Capacity K).
visual_data: \text{Exp: J-Shaped} \\ \text{Logistic: S-Shaped (Sigmoid)}

subject: Biology
title: In-situ vs Ex-situ
description: In-situ (On site): National Parks, Sanctuaries, Biosphere Reserves, Sacred Groves. Ex-situ (Off site): Zoos, Botanical Gardens, Cryopreservation, Seed Banks.
visual_data:
In-situ: Protect whole ecosystem
Ex-situ: Protect specific endangered species

subject: Biology
title: Embryonic Development
description: Zygote -> Morula (8-16 cells) -> Blastocyst (Implants) -> Gastrula (3 Germ layers). Heart forms after 1 month. Limbs/Digits by 2nd month.
visual_data:
1st Month: Heart beat
2nd Month: Limbs/Digits
1st Trimester: Major Organs
5th Month: First Movement / Hair

subject: Biology
title: Lac Operon Regulation
description: Jacob & Monod. Polycistronic structural gene (z, y, a). Regulated by Repressor protein (from i gene). Lactose is Inducer.
visual_data: \text{No Lactose} \to \text{Repressor binds O} \to \text{OFF} \\ \text{Lactose} \to \text{Repressor blocked} \to \text{ON}

subject: Biology
title: Apoplast vs Symplast
description: Apoplast: Cell wall path (Non-living, Fast). Blocked by Casparian Strip. Symplast: Cytoplasm path via Plasmodesmata (Living, Slow).
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 300 120' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect x='10' y='10' width='80' height='100' fill='none' stroke='#000' stroke-width='2'/><rect x='100' y='10' width='80' height='100' fill='none' stroke='#000' stroke-width='2'/><rect x='190' y='10' width='80' height='100' fill='none' stroke='#000' stroke-width='2'/><rect x='195' y='10' width='10' height='100' fill='#EF4444'/><text x='200' y='115' font-size='8' text-anchor='middle'>Casparian</text><path d='M50,15 L90,15 L90,105 L180,105' fill='none' stroke='#EF4444' stroke-width='3' stroke-dasharray='4,2'/><text x='50' y='30' font-size='10' fill='#EF4444'>Apoplast (Wall)</text><path d='M50,60 L140,60 L230,60' fill='none' stroke='#10B981' stroke-width='3'/><text x='50' y='75' font-size='10' fill='#10B981'>Symplast (Cyto)</text><line x1='90' y1='60' x2='100' y2='60' stroke='#10B981' stroke-width='5'/></svg>

subject: Biology
title: Chloroplast Structure
description: Double membrane. Thylakoids (Light Reaction). Stroma (Dark Reaction). Grana (Stacks of Thylakoids). Contains 70S Ribosomes & circular DNA.
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 200 120' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><ellipse cx='100' cy='60' rx='90' ry='50' fill='#D1FAE5' stroke='#065F46' stroke-width='3'/><rect x='40' y='40' width='20' height='40' fill='#10B981'/><rect x='80' y='30' width='20' height='60' fill='#10B981'/><rect x='130' y='45' width='20' height='30' fill='#10B981'/><line x1='60' y1='50' x2='80' y2='50' stroke='#10B981' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='100' y1='60' x2='130' y2='60' stroke='#10B981' stroke-width='2'/><text x='100' y='100' text-anchor='middle' font-size='10' fill='#064E3B'>Stroma</text><text x='140' y='40' font-size='10' fill='#064E3B'>Thylakoid</text></svg>

subject: Biology
title: Enzyme Inhibition Types
description: Competitive: Inhibitor mimics substrate, binds Active Site (\(V_{max}\) same, \(K_m\) increases). Non-competitive: Binds Allosteric Site (\(V_{max}\) decreases).
visual_data: \text{Comp: } K_m \uparrow, V_{max} \text{ same} \\ \text{Non-Comp: } V_{max} \downarrow, K_m \text{ same}

subject: Biology
title: Plant Life Cycles
description: Haplontic (Volvox, Spirogyra). Diplontic (Fucus, Gymnosperms, Angiosperms). Haplo-diplontic (Bryophytes, Pteridophytes).
visual_data:
Haplontic: Zygotic Meiosis (Algae)
Diplontic: Gametic Meiosis (Seed plants)
Haplo-diplontic: Alternation of Gen.

subject: Biology
title: Floral Symmetry
description: Actinomorphic (Radial) - cut in any plane (Mustard, Datura). Zygomorphic (Bilateral) - cut in one plane (Pea, Bean, Gulmohar).
visual_data: \oplus \to \text{Actinomorphic} \\ \% \to \text{Zygomorphic}

subject: Biology
title: Chordata Characteristics
description: 1. Notochord. 2. Dorsal hollow nerve cord. 3. Paired pharyngeal gill slits. 4. Post-anal tail. Closed circulatory system.
visual_data:
Fundamental Features:
1. Notochord (Rod-like)
2. Nerve Cord (Dorsal, Hollow)
3. Gill Slits (Pharyngeal)
4. Post-anal Tail

subject: Biology
title: Secondary Growth (Dicot Stem)
description: Vascular Cambium cuts off Secondary Xylem (inside) and Secondary Phloem (outside). Cork Cambium forms Periderm (Bark).
visual_data: \text{Cambium} \to \text{Sec. Xylem (Wood)} \\ \text{Cambium} \to \text{Sec. Phloem (Bast)}

subject: Biology
title: Ribosome Types
description: Protein factories. Composed of rRNA and proteins. Prokaryotic (70S) and Eukaryotic (80S). 'S' = Svedberg Unit.
visual_data: 70S = 50S + 30S \; (\text{Prokaryotes}) \\ 80S = 60S + 40S \; (\text{Eukaryotes})

subject: Biology
title: Genetic Code Properties
description: Triplet code (61 codons for AA, 3 Stop). Universal (AUG is Start/Met). Degenerate (One AA has multiple codons). Unambiguous.
visual_data:
AUG: Start Codon (Methionine)
UAA, UAG, UGA: Stop Codons
Degenerate: wobble hypothesis

subject: Biology
title: Biotic Potential (r)
description: Intrinsic rate of natural increase. Darwinian fitness. High 'r' means organism reproduces quickly (e.g., bacteria, insects).
visual_data: \frac{dN}{dt} = rN \\ r = (b - d)

subject: Biology
title: Photoreception Mechanism
description: Light -> Dissociation of Retinal from Opsin -> Opsin structure changes -> Membrane potential changes -> Signal to Ganglion cells.
visual_data: \begin{gathered} \text{Rhodopsin} \xrightarrow{\text{Light}} \text{Opsin} + \text{Retinal} \\ \text{Vit A derivative: Retinal (Aldehyde)} \end{gathered}

subject: Biology
title: Lung Volumes
description: TV (Tidal Vol) = 500ml. IRV (Inspiratory Reserve) = 2500-3000ml. ERV (Expiratory Reserve) = 1000-1100ml. RV (Residual) = 1100-1200ml.
visual_data: \begin{gathered} \text{VC} = \text{TV} + \text{IRV} + \text{ERV} \\ \text{TLC} = \text{VC} + \text{RV} \end{gathered}

subject: Biology
title: Blood Group Compatibility
description: Antigens on RBC surface. Antibodies in Plasma. O- is Universal Donor (No antigens). AB+ is Universal Recipient (No antibodies).
visual_data: \begin{gathered} \text{Donor (O)} \to \text{No Antigen} \\ \text{Recipient (AB)} \to \text{No Antibody} \end{gathered}

subject: Biology
title: Human Genome Project
description: Completed 2003. 3 x 10^9 base pairs. 20,000-25,000 genes. Less than 2% codes for proteins. Chromosome 1 has most genes (2968), Y has fewest (231).
visual_data: \begin{gathered} 3.3 \times 10^9 \text{ bp (Haploid)} \\ 99.9\% \text{ Nucleotides same in all humans} \end{gathered}

subject: Biology
title: Hardy-Weinberg Equation
description: Allele frequencies remain constant in absence of disturbing factors. Sum of frequencies is 1.
visual_data: \begin{gathered} p + q = 1 \\ p^2 + 2pq + q^2 = 1 \\ (p^2 \text{ AA}, q^2 \text{ aa}, 2pq \text{ Aa}) \end{gathered}

subject: Biology
title: Protein Digestion Sequence
visual_data: \text{Proteins} \xrightarrow{\text{Pepsin (Stomach)}} \text{Peptones} \xrightarrow{\text{Trypsin (Pancreas)}} \text{Dipeptides} \xrightarrow{\text{Dipeptidase (Intestine)}} \text{Amino Acids}
description: Sequential breakdown of proteins. Pepsin requires acidic pH (1.8). Trypsin/Chymotrypsin require alkaline pH (7.8) activated by Enterokinase.

subject: Biology
title: Human Dental Formula
description: Arrangement of teeth in each half of upper and lower jaw: Incisors (2), Canines (1), Premolars (2), Molars (3). Thecodont, Diphyodont, Heterodont.
derivation: Child Formula: 2102/2102 (20 teeth). No Premolars in milk teeth.

subject: Biology
title: Respiratory Capacities
visual_data: \begin{aligned} \text{IC} &= \text{TV} + \text{IRV} \\ \text{FRC} &= \text{ERV} + \text{RV} \\ \text{VC} &= \text{ERV} + \text{TV} + \text{IRV} \end{aligned}
description: Derived volumes. Vital Capacity (VC) is max air breathed out after forced inspiration. FRC is air remaining after normal expiration.

subject: Biology
title: Coagulation Cascade
visual_data: \text{Prothrombin} \xrightarrow{\text{Thrombokinase}} \text{Thrombin} \\ \text{Fibrinogen} \xrightarrow{\text{Thrombin}} \text{Fibrin}
description: Cascade mechanism. Calcium ions ($Ca^{++}$) play a crucial role in both steps. Vitamin K required for Prothrombin synthesis.

subject: Biology
title: Counter Current Mechanism
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 200 200' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><path d='M60,20 L60,160 Q80,180 100,160 L100,20' fill='none' stroke='#F59E0B' stroke-width='3'/><path d='M120,20 L120,160 Q140,180 160,160 L160,20' fill='none' stroke='#EF4444' stroke-width='3'/><text x='30' y='90' font-size='10' transform='rotate(90 30,90)'>Henle Loop</text><text x='180' y='90' font-size='10' transform='rotate(90 180,90)'>Vasa Recta</text><text x='80' y='190' font-size='10' text-anchor='middle'>High Osmolarity (1200)</text><text x='80' y='15' font-size='10' text-anchor='middle'>Cortex (300)</text><path d='M70,50 L90,50' stroke='#000' marker-end='url(#arrow)'/><path d='M130,130 L150,130' stroke='#000' marker-end='url(#arrow)'/></svg>
description: Henle's Loop and Vasa Recta. Multiplies osmolarity from 300 (Cortex) to 1200 mOsm (Medulla). Essential for concentrating urine.
derivation: NaCl transported by ascending limb exchanged with descending Vasa Recta.

subject: Biology
title: Sliding Filament Theory
visual_data: \text{Actin slides over Myosin} \to \text{Sarcomere Shortens} \\ \text{H-zone disappears, I-band shortens, A-band constant}
description: Mechanism of muscle contraction. Calcium binds Troponin $\to$ Unmasks Actin $\to$ Myosin head binds $\to$ Power stroke (ATP hydrolysis).

subject: Biology
title: Internal Ear (Cochlea)
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 200 200' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><circle cx='100' cy='100' r='90' fill='none' stroke='#000'/><path d='M20,100 Q100,20 180,100' fill='none' stroke='#000'/><path d='M20,100 Q100,180 180,100' fill='none' stroke='#000'/><text x='100' y='60' text-anchor='middle'>Scala Vestibuli (Perilymph)</text><text x='100' y='140' text-anchor='middle'>Scala Tympani (Perilymph)</text><path d='M30,100 L170,100' stroke='#000' stroke-width='2'/><text x='100' y='95' text-anchor='middle' font-size='10'>Organ of Corti</text><text x='100' y='115' text-anchor='middle' font-size='10'>Basilar Membrane</text></svg>
description: Hearing organ. Organ of Corti on Basilar Membrane. Hair cells act as receptors. Vibrations in fluid bend hair cells against Tectorial Membrane.
derivation: Sound $\to$ Ear Drum $\to$ Ossicles $\to$ Oval Window $\to$ Cochlear Fluid.

subject: Biology
title: Adrenal Gland Hormones
visual_data: \text{Cortex} \begin{cases} \text{Glucocorticoids (Cortisol)} \\ \text{Mineralocorticoids (Aldosterone)} \end{cases} \\ \text{Medulla} \to \text{Adrenaline (Fight/Flight)}
description: Cortisol: Anti-inflammatory, Gluconeogenesis. Aldosterone: $Na^+$ and Water reabsorption. Adrenaline: Emergency hormone.
derivation: 3 Layers of Cortex: Glomerulosa, Fasciculata, Reticularis.

subject: Biology
title: Sperm Structure
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 100 250' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><ellipse cx='50' cy='30' rx='20' ry='25' fill='#E0F2FE' stroke='#3B82F6'/><path d='M30,10 Q50,0 70,10' fill='#FCA5A5' stroke='#EF4444' stroke-width='2'/><text x='50' y='20' text-anchor='middle' font-size='8'>Acrosome</text><rect x='40' y='55' width='20' height='40' fill='#D1FAE5' stroke='#10B981'/><text x='80' y='75' font-size='8'>Middle Piece (Mitochondria)</text><path d='M50,95 Q60,150 50,240' fill='none' stroke='#000' stroke-width='2'/><text x='60' y='200' font-size='8'>Tail</text></svg>
description: Head (Nucleus + Acrosome with lytic enzymes). Middle Piece (Mitochondria - Powerhouse for motility). Tail (Flagellum).
derivation: Acrosome is derived from Golgi body.

subject: Biology
title: Xylem vs Phloem
visual_data: \text{Xylem (Water)}: \text{Tracheids, Vessels, Fibres, Parenchyma} \\ \text{Phloem (Food)}: \text{Sieve Tubes, Companion Cells, Fibres, Parenchyma}
description: Complex permanent tissues. Xylem is mostly dead (except Parenchyma). Phloem is mostly living (except Fibres). Gymnosperms lack Vessels.
derivation: Companion cells control Sieve tubes (which lack nucleus).

subject: Biology
title: Floral Formula Symbols
visual_data: \oplus \text{ (Actinomorphic)}, \% \text{ (Zygomorphic)} \\ K_{(5)} \text{ (Gamosepalous)}, C_5 \text{ (Polypetalous)} \\ A_{(9)+1} \text{ (Diadelphous)}, G_{\underline{1}} \text{ (Superior Ovary)}
derivation: Standard technical description of flowering plants.

subject: Biology
title: Crossing Over
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 200 150' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><path d='M60,20 L60,130' stroke='#3B82F6' stroke-width='4'/><path d='M80,20 L80,130' stroke='#3B82F6' stroke-width='4'/><path d='M120,20 L120,130' stroke='#EF4444' stroke-width='4'/><path d='M140,20 L140,130' stroke='#EF4444' stroke-width='4'/><circle cx='100' cy='75' r='20' fill='none' stroke='#000' stroke-dasharray='2,2'/><text x='100' y='145' text-anchor='middle' font-size='10'>Recombination Nodule</text><path d='M80,75 L120,75' stroke='#000' stroke-width='2'/></svg>
description: Exchange of genetic material between non-sister chromatids of homologous chromosomes. Enzyme: Recombinase. Occurs in Pachytene.

subject: Biology
title: Algae Classification
visual_data: \begin{array}{l|l|l} \text{Class} & \text{Pigments} & \text{Food} \\ \hline \text{Chlorophyceae} & \text{Chl a, b} & \text{Starch} \\ \text{Phaeophyceae} & \text{Chl a, c, Fucoxanthin} & \text{Mannitol} \\ \text{Rhodophyceae} & \text{Chl a, d, Phycoerythrin} & \text{Floridean} \end{array}
description: Green (Volvox), Brown (Fucus, Kelp), Red (Polysiphonia). Brown algae have Algin coating. Red algae produce Agar.
derivation: Pigment depth penetration: Red algae found deepest (absorb blue light).

subject: Biology
title: Phyla Features Summary
visual_data: \begin{array}{l} \text{Porifera: Cellular, Choanocytes} \\ \text{Cnidaria: Tissue, Cnidoblasts} \\ \text{Platyhelminthes: Acoelomate, Flame Cells} \\ \text{Arthropoda: Jointed legs, Chitin} \end{array}
description: Key distinguishing features. Annelida (Metamerism), Mollusca (Radula/Mantle), Echinodermata (Water Vascular System).
derivation: Evolutionary trend: Cellular $\to$ Tissue $\to$ Organ $\to$ Organ System.

subject: Biology
title: Types of RNA
visual_data: \begin{array}{l} \text{mRNA (Messenger): Template} \\ \text{tRNA (Transfer): Adapter (reads code)} \\ \text{rRNA (Ribosomal): Structural/Catalytic} \end{array}
description: rRNA is most abundant (80%). 23S rRNA acts as Ribozyme (Peptide bond formation). mRNA carries codon info.

subject: Biology
title: Bt Cotton Mechanism
visual_data: \text{Cry gene} \to \text{Inactive Protoxin} \xrightarrow{\text{Alkaline pH (Gut)}} \text{Active Toxin}
description: Bacillus thuringiensis. Toxin binds to midgut epithelium of insect $\to$ Lysis $\to$ Death. CryIAc (Bollworm), CryIAb (Corn borer).

subject: Biology
title: Carbon vs Phosphorus Cycle
visual_data: \text{Carbon: Gaseous (Atmosphere)} \\ \text{Phosphorus: Sedimentary (Rocks)}
description: Carbon flows through photosynthesis/respiration. Phosphorus flows through weathering/absorption. No respiratory release of Phosphorus.

subject: Biology
title: Types of Mutation
visual_data: \text{Point: Change in single base pair (Sickle Cell)} \\ \text{Frameshift: Insertion/Deletion (Thalassemia)}
description: Sickle Cell: GAG $\to$ GUG (Glu $\to$ Val). Frame shift changes the entire reading frame.

subject: Biology
title: Fluid Mosaic Model
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 300 100' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect x='0' y='30' width='300' height='40' fill='#F3F4F6'/><circle cx='20' cy='30' r='5' fill='#3B82F6'/><line x1='20' y1='30' x2='20' y2='50' stroke='#000'/><circle cx='20' cy='70' r='5' fill='#3B82F6'/><line x1='20' y1='70' x2='20' y2='50' stroke='#000'/><text x='20' y='15' font-size='8'>Polar Head</text><ellipse cx='80' cy='50' rx='15' ry='30' fill='#F59E0B'/><text x='80' y='90' font-size='8'>Integral Protein</text><circle cx='140' cy='25' r='10' fill='#10B981'/><text x='140' y='10' font-size='8'>Peripheral</text><path d='M200,30 L210,10 L220,30' fill='none' stroke='#000'/><text x='230' y='20' font-size='8'>Sugar Chain</text></svg>
description: Singer & Nicolson (1972). Phospholipid bilayer (fluidity) with embedded proteins (mosaic). Proteins: Integral (Tunnel) and Peripheral. Cholesterol provides stability.
derivation: Quasi-fluid nature enables cell growth, secretion, endocytosis.

subject: Biology
title: Blackman's Law of Limiting Factors
visual_data: \text{Rate} \propto \text{Factor closest to minimum value}
description: Photosynthesis rate is limited by the factor in shortest supply (CO2, Light, Temp, Water). Usually CO2 is the limiting factor for C3 plants.
derivation: Light saturation at 10% of full sunlight.

subject: Biology
title: Respiratory Quotient (RQ)
visual_data: RQ = \frac{\text{Vol. } CO_2 \text{ evolved}}{\text{Vol. } O_2 \text{ consumed}}
description: Carbohydrates: 1.0. Fats: 0.7 (Tripalmitin). Proteins: 0.9. Organic Acids: > 1.

subject: Biology
title: Fruit Types
visual_data: \text{Drupe: Stony Endocarp (Mango, Coconut)} \\ \text{Parthenocarpic: Seedless (Banana)}
description: True Fruit: Developed from ovary. False Fruit: Thalamus contributes (Apple, Strawberry). Parthenocarpic: Without fertilization.

subject: Biology
title: Cockroach Excretion
visual_data: \text{Malpighian Tubules} \to \text{Uric Acid (Uricotelic)}
description: Tubules lined by glandular and ciliated cells. Absorb nitrogenous waste from hemolymph and convert to uric acid. Hindgut reabsorbs water.
derivation: Fat body, nephrocytes, and urecose glands also help.

subject: Biology
title: Bonds in DNA
visual_data: \text{N-Glycosidic: Sugar + Base} \\ \text{Phosphodiester: Sugar + Phosphate (Backbone)} \\ \text{Hydrogen: Base + Base}
description: Nucleoside = Sugar + Base. Nucleotide = Nucleoside + Phosphate.

subject: Biology
title: Viruses & Viroids
visual_data: \text{Virus: Nucleoprotein (DNA/RNA + Capsid)} \\ \text{Viroid: Free RNA (No coat, Low MW)} \\ \text{Prion: Abnormal Protein}
description: Virus (Ivanowsky/Stanley). Viroid (T.O. Diener - Potato Spindle Tuber). Prion (Mad Cow Disease).
derivation: Connect link between living and non-living.

subject: Biology
title: Evil Quartet (Loss Causes)
visual_data:
1. Habitat Loss & Fragmentation (Most imp)
2. Over-exploitation
3. Alien Species Invasion (Water Hyacinth)
4. Co-extinction

subject: Biology
title: Nucleosome Model
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 200 150' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><circle cx='100' cy='80' r='40' fill='#E5E7EB' stroke='#9CA3AF'/><text x='100' y='85' text-anchor='middle' font-size='10'>Histone Octamer</text><path d='M40,120 Q100,20 160,120' fill='none' stroke='#EF4444' stroke-width='4'/><text x='170' y='130' font-size='10' fill='#EF4444'>DNA (200 bp)</text><rect x='140' y='50' width='10' height='20' fill='#3B82F6'/><text x='160' y='60' font-size='10' fill='#3B82F6'>H1</text></svg>
description: DNA packaging. Negatively charged DNA wrapped around Positively charged Histone Octamer (H2A, H2B, H3, H4 x2). H1 is linker histone.

subject: Biology
title: Sex Determination
visual_data: \text{XX-XY: Human, Drosophila (Male Het)} \\ \text{XX-XO: Grasshopper (Male Het)} \\ \text{ZZ-ZW: Birds (Female Het)}
description: Heterogametic sex produces two types of gametes determining the sex of offspring.

subject: Biology
title: Greenhouse Gases
description: Contribution to Global Warming. Gases absorb long-wave IR radiation from Earth.
derivation: Kyoto Protocol targets reduction of these gases.

subject: Biology
title: Genetically Engineered Insulin
visual_data: \text{Eli Lilly (1983)}: \text{Chain A & B produced separately in E. coli} \to \text{Combined via Disulfide bonds}
description: Overcame problem of C-peptide removal. Trade name: Humulin.

subject: Biology
title: Human Brain Structure
description: Forebrain (Cerebrum, Thalamus, Hypothalamus). Midbrain (Corpora Quadrigemina). Hindbrain (Pons, Cerebellum, Medulla). Corpus Callosum connects hemispheres.
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 200 150' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><path d='M40,100 Q40,20 120,20 Q180,20 180,80 Q180,100 140,100' fill='#E0F2FE' stroke='#3B82F6' stroke-width='2'/><path d='M140,100 Q170,100 170,130 Q140,140 120,120' fill='#FECACA' stroke='#EF4444' stroke-width='2'/><path d='M120,100 L110,140' stroke='#000' stroke-width='4'/><text x='90' y='50' font-size='10'>Cerebrum</text><text x='160' y='120' font-size='8' fill='#991B1B'>Cerebellum</text><text x='90' y='130' font-size='8'>Medulla</text><path d='M90,70 Q110,70 130,80' fill='none' stroke='#000'/><text x='80' y='80' font-size='8'>Corpus Callosum</text></svg>

subject: Biology
title: Reflex Arc
description: Involuntary response. Receptor -> Sensory Neuron (Dorsal root) -> Spinal Cord (Interneuron) -> Motor Neuron (Ventral root) -> Effector (Muscle).
visual_data: \text{Stimulus} \to \text{Receptor} \xrightarrow{\text{Sensory}} \text{CNS} \xrightarrow{\text{Motor}} \text{Muscle}

subject: Biology
title: Types of Joints
description: Fibrous (Skull sutures - No movement). Cartilaginous (Vertebrae - Slight movement). Synovial (Fluid filled - Free movement).
visual_data:
Ball & Socket: Shoulder/Hip
Hinge: Elbow/Knee
Pivot: Atlas & Axis
Gliding: Carpals
Saddle: Thumb

subject: Biology
title: Miller-Urey Experiment
description: Chemical Evolution. Simulated primitive earth: CH4, NH3, H2, Water vapor at 800C + Electric Discharge. Result: Amino Acids formed.
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 200 150' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><circle cx='150' cy='40' r='30' fill='none' stroke='#000'/><text x='150' y='45' text-anchor='middle' font-size='8'>Gases + Spark</text><path d='M150,70 L150,120 L50,120 L50,80' fill='none' stroke='#000'/><rect x='30' y='80' width='40' height='30' fill='#BFDBFE'/><text x='50' y='100' text-anchor='middle' font-size='8'>Boiling Water</text><text x='100' y='140' text-anchor='middle' font-size='10' fill='#EF4444'>Amino Acids</text></svg>

subject: Biology
title: Post-Transcriptional Modifications
description: Eukaryotes only. hnRNA -> Capping (5' mGPPP) + Tailing (3' Poly-A) + Splicing (Introns removed, Exons joined) -> mRNA.
visual_data: \text{Exons (Coding)} + \text{Introns (Non-coding)} \\ \xrightarrow{\text{Spliceosome}} \text{Mature mRNA (Exons only)}

subject: Biology
title: Embryo Sac Structure
description: Female Gametophyte. 7-celled, 8-nucleate. Egg apparatus (Egg + 2 Synergids) at micropyle. 3 Antipodals at chalaza. Central cell (2 Polar nuclei).
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 100 200' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><ellipse cx='50' cy='100' rx='40' ry='90' fill='#F3F4F6' stroke='#000'/><circle cx='50' cy='170' r='8' fill='#EF4444'/><circle cx='35' cy='180' r='6' fill='#FCA5A5'/><circle cx='65' cy='180' r='6' fill='#FCA5A5'/><text x='50' y='195' text-anchor='middle' font-size='8'>Egg Apparatus</text><circle cx='50' cy='100' r='5' fill='#000'/><circle cx='60' cy='100' r='5' fill='#000'/><text x='80' y='100' font-size='8'>Polar Nuclei</text><circle cx='50' cy='30' r='6' fill='#3B82F6'/><circle cx='35' cy='30' r='6' fill='#3B82F6'/><circle cx='65' cy='30' r='6' fill='#3B82F6'/><text x='50' y='15' text-anchor='middle' font-size='8'>Antipodals</text></svg>

subject: Biology
title: Bacteriophage Structure
description: Virus that infects bacteria. Polyhedral Head (Capsid containing DNA), Collar, Sheath, Tail Fibres (attachment).
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 150 200' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><path d='M50,20 L100,20 L110,50 L40,50 Z' fill='#E5E7EB' stroke='#000'/><rect x='65' y='50' width='20' height='60' fill='#9CA3AF' stroke='#000'/><line x1='65' y1='110' x2='20' y2='150' stroke='#000' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='85' y1='110' x2='130' y2='150' stroke='#000' stroke-width='2'/><text x='75' y='35' text-anchor='middle' font-size='8'>Head</text><text x='75' y='80' text-anchor='middle' font-size='8'>Sheath</text><text x='75' y='160' text-anchor='middle' font-size='8'>Tail Fibres</text></svg>

subject: Biology
title: Cardiac Cycle (0.8s)
description: Sequence of events in one heartbeat. Atrial Systole (0.1s) -> Ventricular Systole (0.3s) -> Joint Diastole (0.4s). Stroke Volume = 70ml.
visual_data: \text{Lub} \to \text{Closure of AV valves (Vent. Systole)} \\ \text{Dub} \to \text{Closure of Semilunar valves (Vent. Diastole)}

subject: Biology
title: Hormone Action Mechanism
description: Protein Hormones (Insulin): Bind membrane receptor -> Second messenger (cAMP/Ca++) -> Response. Steroid Hormones (Estrogen): Cross membrane -> Bind intracellular receptor -> Gene expression.
visual_data:
Membrane Bound: Fast, Cascade effect (e.g., FSH)
Intracellular: Slow, regulate DNA (e.g., Cortisol)

subject: Biology
title: Vascular Bundles
description: Radial (Roots). Conjoint (Stems/Leaves). Open (Cambium present - Dicots). Closed (No Cambium - Monocots).
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 200 100' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><circle cx='50' cy='50' r='40' fill='none' stroke='#000'/><path d='M20,50 L80,50' stroke='#000'/><rect x='30' y='45' width='40' height='10' fill='#EF4444'/><text x='50' y='30' text-anchor='middle' font-size='8'>Phloem</text><text x='50' y='50' text-anchor='middle' font-size='8' fill='#fff'>Cambium</text><text x='50' y='80' text-anchor='middle' font-size='8'>Xylem</text><text x='50' y='95' text-anchor='middle' font-size='8'>Conjoint Open (Dicot)</text></svg>

subject: Biology
title: Cancer Biology
description: Uncontrolled cell division. Loss of Contact Inhibition. Metastasis (spread to other organs). Benign (localized) vs Malignant (spreading) tumors.
visual_data:
Carcinogens: UV, Tobacco, X-rays
Genes: Proto-oncogenes (normal) -> Oncogenes (cancer)

subject: Biology
title: Michaelis-Menten Graph
description: Hyperbolic curve. Vmax = Max velocity. Km = Substrate concentration at Vmax/2. Low Km = High Affinity.
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 200 150' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><line x1='20' y1='130' x2='180' y2='130' stroke='#000'/><line x1='20' y1='10' x2='20' y2='130' stroke='#000'/><path d='M20,130 Q40,30 180,30' fill='none' stroke='#3B82F6' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='20' y1='30' x2='180' y2='30' stroke='#000' stroke-dasharray='4,2'/><text x='10' y='30' font-size='10'>Vmax</text><line x1='20' y1='80' x2='60' y2='80' stroke='#000' stroke-dasharray='4,2'/><text x='10' y='80' font-size='10'>Vmax/2</text><line x1='60' y1='80' x2='60' y2='130' stroke='#000' stroke-dasharray='4,2'/><text x='60' y='145' font-size='10'>Km</text></svg>

subject: Biology
title: Cnidoblast Structure
description: Characteristic of Coelenterata (Cnidaria). Stinging cell for defense/prey. Contains nematocyst (capsule with toxin).
visual_data:
Function: Anchorage, Defense, Capture of Prey
Example: Hydra, Jellyfish, Sea Anemone

subject: Biology
title: Leaf Phyllotaxy
description: Pattern of leaf arrangement. Alternate (China Rose - 1 per node). Opposite (Guava - 2 per node). Whorled (Alstonia - >2 per node).
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 200 80' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><line x1='30' y1='10' x2='30' y2='70' stroke='#059669'/><path d='M30,30 L10,20' stroke='#10B981'/><path d='M30,50 L50,40' stroke='#10B981'/><text x='30' y='78' text-anchor='middle' font-size='8'>Alternate</text><line x1='100' y1='10' x2='100' y2='70' stroke='#059669'/><path d='M100,40 L80,30' stroke='#10B981'/><path d='M100,40 L120,30' stroke='#10B981'/><text x='100' y='78' text-anchor='middle' font-size='8'>Opposite</text></svg>

subject: Biology
title: Regulation of Respiration
description: Respiratory Rhythm Centre (Medulla). Pneumotaxic Centre (Pons) - reduces duration of inspiration. Chemosensitive Area - sensitive to CO2 and H+.
visual_data: \text{High } CO_2/H^+ \to \text{Signal to Rhythm Centre} \to \text{Increase Breathing Rate}

subject: Biology
title: Liver & Bile
description: Largest gland. Hepatic lobules (structural unit). Secretes Bile (No enzymes, emulsifies fats). Bile stored in Gall Bladder.
visual_data: \text{Fat} \xrightarrow{\text{Bile}} \text{Emulsified Fat (Micelles)} \xrightarrow{\text{Lipase}} \text{Fatty Acids}

subject: Biology
title: Cilia/Flagella Structure
description: 9+2 Arrangement of microtubules in axoneme. 9 peripheral doublets + 2 central singlets. Basal body has 9+0 arrangement.
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 100 100' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><circle cx='50' cy='50' r='45' fill='none' stroke='#000'/><circle cx='50' cy='50' r='40' fill='#E5E7EB'/><circle cx='45' cy='50' r='3' fill='#3B82F6'/><circle cx='55' cy='50' r='3' fill='#3B82F6'/><text x='50' y='50' text-anchor='middle' font-size='6'>2</text><circle cx='50' cy='10' r='4' fill='#EF4444'/><circle cx='85' cy='30' r='4' fill='#EF4444'/><circle cx='85' cy='70' r='4' fill='#EF4444'/><circle cx='50' cy='90' r='4' fill='#EF4444'/><circle cx='15' cy='70' r='4' fill='#EF4444'/><circle cx='15' cy='30' r='4' fill='#EF4444'/><text x='50' y='65' text-anchor='middle' font-size='6'>9+2</text></svg>

subject: Biology
title: Follicular Development
description: Primary Follicle -> Secondary -> Tertiary (Antrum fluid cavity) -> Graafian Follicle (mature). Ruptures to release ovum -> Corpus Luteum.
visual_data: \text{Graafian Follicle} \xrightarrow{\text{LH Surge}} \text{Ovum} + \text{Corpus Luteum (Progesterone)}

subject: Biology
title: Phosphorus Cycle
description: Sedimentary cycle. Reservoir: Rocks. Weathering releases phosphate -> Soil -> Plants -> Animals -> Detritus -> Soil.
visual_data:
Difference from Carbon Cycle:
1. No respiratory release of P
2. Atmospheric input is negligible

subject: Biology
title: RNA Interference (RNAi)
description: Gene silencing defense in eukaryotes. dsRNA binds to mRNA and destroys it, preventing translation. Used in nematode resistant tobacco (Meloidegyne incognita).
visual_data: \text{dsRNA} \to \text{siRNA} \to \text{RISC Complex} \to \text{mRNA Cleavage (Silencing)}

subject: Biology
title: Electron Transport System (ETS)
description: Inner Mitochondrial Membrane. Complex I (NADH dehydrogenase), II (Succinate dehydrogenase), III (Cytochrome bc1), IV (Cytochrome c oxidase), V (ATP Synthase). Final acceptor is Oxygen.
visual_data: \frac{1}{2}O_2 + 2H^+ + 2e^- \to H_2O \; (\text{Metabolic Water})

subject: Biology
title: Photorespiration (C2 Cycle)
description: Wasteful process in C3 plants when RuBisCO binds O2 instead of CO2. Occurs in Chloroplast -> Peroxisome -> Mitochondria. No ATP/Sugar produced.
visual_data: \text{RuBP} + O_2 \xrightarrow{\text{RuBisCO}} \text{Phosphoglycerate (3C)} + \text{Phosphoglycolate (2C)}

subject: Biology
title: Photoperiodism
description: Response to day length. LDP (Long Day): Flower when day > critical (Wheat). SDP (Short Day): Flower when day < critical (Tobacco). Day Neutral (Tomato).
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 200 100' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect x='20' y='20' width='60' height='20' fill='#FDE68A' stroke='#000'/><text x='50' y='35' text-anchor='middle' font-size='8'>Light</text><rect x='80' y='20' width='100' height='20' fill='#4B5563' stroke='#000'/><text x='130' y='35' text-anchor='middle' font-size='8' fill='#fff'>Dark (Critical)</text><text x='100' y='60' text-anchor='middle' font-size='10'>SDP requires long dark period</text></svg>

subject: Biology
title: Lymphatic System
description: Tissue fluid (Interstitial fluid). Similar to plasma but fewer proteins. Carries fats (Lacteals in villi) and lymphocytes (Immunity). Drains back to veins.
visual_data: \text{Lymph} = \text{Blood} - (\text{RBCs} + \text{Platelets} + \text{Large Proteins})

subject: Biology
title: Haemodialysis
description: Artificial Kidney. Blood pumped into unit with dialysing fluid (same composition as plasma except nitrogenous waste). Waste diffuses out.
visual_data:
Anti-coagulant used: Heparin
Principle: Diffusion across semi-permeable cellophane membrane

subject: Biology
title: Parathyroid Hormone (PTH)
description: Hypercalcemic hormone. Increases blood Ca++ by bone resorption (demineralization) and reabsorption in kidney. Antagonistic to TCT (Thyrocalcitonin).
visual_data: PTH \uparrow Ca^{++} \text{ (Blood)} \\ TCT \downarrow Ca^{++} \text{ (Blood)}

subject: Biology
title: Parturition (Childbirth)
description: Neuroendocrine mechanism. Fetal Ejection Reflex: Signals from fully developed fetus/placenta -> Oxytocin release (Pituitary) -> Uterine Contractions.
visual_data: \text{Fetal Signal} \to \text{Oxytocin} \to \text{Stronger Contraction} \to \text{More Oxytocin}

subject: Biology
title: Test Cross
description: Cross between dominant phenotype (unknown genotype) and recessive parent. Used to determine if individual is Homozygous (TT) or Heterozygous (Tt).
visual_data: \text{If 100\% Tall} \to \text{Parent was TT} \\ \text{If 50\% Tall, 50\% Dwarf} \to \text{Parent was Tt}

subject: Biology
title: Polygenic Inheritance
description: Quantitative inheritance. Trait controlled by 3 or more genes. Additive effect. Example: Human Skin Color (AABBCC = Darkest, aabbcc = Lightest).
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 200 100' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><path d='M10,90 Q100,10 190,90' fill='none' stroke='#000'/><line x1='100' y1='10' x2='100' y2='90' stroke='#000' stroke-dasharray='4,2'/><text x='100' y='95' text-anchor='middle' font-size='8'>Intermediate Skin Color</text><text x='10' y='95' font-size='8'>Light</text><text x='190' y='95' font-size='8'>Dark</text></svg>

subject: Biology
title: Adaptive Radiation
description: Evolution of different species from a common ancestor starting in a geographical area and radiating to other habitats. Ex: Darwin's Finches, Australian Marsupials.
visual_data:
Darwin's Finches: Beak shape changed based on food (Seed, Insect, Cactus)
Marsupials: Wolf, Tiger Cat, Anteater (all marsupial)

subject: Biology
title: Common Bacterial Diseases
description: Typhoid (Salmonella typhi - Widal Test). Pneumonia (Streptococcus pneumoniae - Alveoli fluid). Plague (Yersinia pestis).
visual_data:
Typhoid: High fever, stomach pain, perforation
Pneumonia: Chills, gray/bluish lips/nails

subject: Biology
title: Sewage Treatment
description: Primary (Physical): Filtration/Sedimentation. Secondary (Biological): Aeration tanks (Flocs consume organic matter, reduce BOD) -> Anaerobic Sludge Digester.
visual_data: BOD \propto \text{Polluting Potential} \\ \text{Flocs} = \text{Bacteria} + \text{Fungal Filaments}

subject: Biology
title: Ethical Issues (GEAC)
description: GEAC (Genetic Engineering Appraisal Committee). Validates GM research and safety of releasing GM organisms. Biopiracy: Theft of bio-resources (e.g., Basmati rice patent).
visual_data:
Functions of GEAC:
1. Safety of GM crops
2. Field trials approval
3. Environmental impact assessment

subject: Biology
title: Decomposition Steps
description: Breakdown of detritus. 1. Fragmentation (Earthworm). 2. Leaching (Water soluble nutrients go down). 3. Catabolism (Enzymes). 4. Humification. 5. Mineralization.
visual_data:
Detritivores: Earthworms (Farmer's friend)
Factors: Warm/Moist (Fast), Chitin/Lignin rich (Slow)

subject: Biology
title: Pollination Agents
description: Anemophily (Wind - Maize, Grasses; non-sticky pollen). Hydrophily (Water - Vallisneria, Zostera). Entomophily (Insect - Yucca/Moth, Amorphophallus).
visual_data:
Wind: Exposed stamens, feathery stigma
Insect: Colorful, Nectar, Sticky pollen
Yucca: Obligate mutualism with Moth

subject: Biology
title: Tissue Culture
description: Totipotency: Capacity of a cell to generate whole plant. Explant grown in nutrient medium. Micropropagation (Somaclones). Virus-free plants (Meristem culture).
visual_data: \text{Explant} \xrightarrow{\text{Auxin/Cytokinin}} \text{Callus} \to \text{Plantlet}

subject: Biology
title: Drugs & Alcohol Abuse
description: Opioids (Heroin/Smack - Depressant). Cannabinoids (Marijuana - Cardiovascular). Coca alkaloids (Coke - Euphoria). Hallucinogens (LSD, Datura).
visual_data:
Cirrhosis: Liver damage from Alcohol
Withdrawal: Anxiety, Shakiness, Nausea

subject: Biology
title: Human Evolution
description: Dryopithecus (Ape-like) -> Ramapithecus -> Australopithecus (2mya, Fruit) -> Homo habilis (First human-like, 650cc) -> Homo erectus (Meat eater, 900cc) -> Homo sapiens.
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 200 60' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><line x1='10' y1='30' x2='190' y2='30' stroke='#000'/><circle cx='30' cy='30' r='5' fill='#000'/><text x='30' y='50' text-anchor='middle' font-size='8'>Australo</text><circle cx='80' cy='30' r='5' fill='#000'/><text x='80' y='50' text-anchor='middle' font-size='8'>Habilis</text><circle cx='130' cy='30' r='5' fill='#000'/><text x='130' y='50' text-anchor='middle' font-size='8'>Erectus</text><circle cx='180' cy='30' r='5' fill='#000'/><text x='180' y='50' text-anchor='middle' font-size='8'>Sapiens</text><text x='80' y='15' text-anchor='middle' font-size='6'>650-800cc</text><text x='130' y='15' text-anchor='middle' font-size='6'>900cc</text></svg>

subject: Biology
title: Nucleus Structure
description: Double membrane (Nuclear envelope) with pores. Nucleoplasm contains Chromatin (DNA+Histones) and Nucleolus (rRNA synthesis site).
visual_data:
Heterochromatin: Densely packed, Transcriptionally inactive
Euchromatin: Loosely packed, Active

subject: Biology
title: Stratification
description: Vertical distribution of different species occupying different levels. Example in Forest: Trees (Top) -> Shrubs (Middle) -> Herbs/Grasses (Bottom).
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 100 150' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect x='20' y='130' width='60' height='20' fill='#A7F3D0'/><text x='50' y='145' text-anchor='middle' font-size='8'>Herbs</text><rect x='20' y='90' width='60' height='40' fill='#34D399'/><text x='50' y='115' text-anchor='middle' font-size='8'>Shrubs</text><rect x='10' y='10' width='80' height='80' fill='#059669'/><text x='50' y='50' text-anchor='middle' font-size='8'>Trees</text></svg>

subject: Biology
title: Bryophytes (Amphibians of Plant Kingdom)
description: Liverworts (Marchantia) & Mosses (Funaria). Depend on water for fertilization. Dominant phase: Gametophyte (n). Sporophyte depends on Gametophyte.
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 100 150' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><path d='M50,140 Q20,120 10,100 Q30,120 50,130 Q70,120 90,100 Q80,120 50,140' fill='#10B981' stroke='#064E3B'/><text x='50' y='145' text-anchor='middle' font-size='8'>Gametophyte (n)</text><line x1='50' y1='130' x2='50' y2='50' stroke='#F59E0B' stroke-width='2'/><text x='60' y='90' font-size='8'>Seta</text><ellipse cx='50' cy='40' rx='10' ry='15' fill='#F59E0B'/><text x='50' y='20' text-anchor='middle' font-size='8'>Capsule (2n)</text></svg>

subject: Biology
title: Pteridophytes (Ferns)
description: First terrestrial vascular plants (Xylem/Phloem). Dominant phase: Sporophyte (2n). Gametophyte (Prothallus) is small, free-living, photosynthetic.
visual_data:
Examples: Selaginella, Equisetum
Spores: Homosporous (Similiar) or Heterosporous (Different - Selaginella)

subject: Biology
title: Aschelminthes (Roundworms)
description: Pseudocoelomates (False body cavity). Bilateral symmetry. Muscular pharynx. Sexual dimorphism (Males shorter than Females).
visual_data: \text{Ascaris (Roundworm)} \\ \text{Wuchereria (Filarial worm)} \\ \text{Ancylostoma (Hookworm)}

subject: Biology
title: Dicot vs Monocot Seed
description: Dicot: 2 Cotyledons, Embryonal axis (Plumule/Radicle). Monocot: 1 Cotyledon (Scutellum), Aleurone layer (Protein), Endosperm (Food).
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 200 100' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><ellipse cx='50' cy='50' rx='30' ry='40' fill='#FEF3C7' stroke='#D97706'/><path d='M50,10 L50,90' stroke='#D97706'/><text x='50' y='50' text-anchor='middle' font-size='8'>Dicot (2 Cots)</text><rect x='120' y='10' width='60' height='80' fill='#E5E7EB' stroke='#000'/><rect x='125' y='15' width='50' height='50' fill='#FDE68A'/><text x='150' y='40' text-anchor='middle' font-size='8'>Endosperm</text><rect x='125' y='70' width='50' height='15' fill='#10B981'/><text x='150' y='80' text-anchor='middle' font-size='8'>Embryo</text></svg>

subject: Biology
title: Absorption Mechanisms
description: Simple Diffusion (Small amts of Glucose, Amino acids, Cl-). Facilitated Transport (Glucose, AA with carrier Na+). Active Transport (Against gradient - Na+).
visual_data: \text{Fats} \to \text{Micelles} \to \text{Chylomicrons (Protein coated)} \to \text{Lacteals (Lymph)}

subject: Biology
title: Transport of Gases
description: O2: 97% by RBC (Oxyhaemoglobin), 3% dissolved in plasma. CO2: 70% as Bicarbonate (HCO3-), 20-25% as Carbamino-Hb, 7% dissolved.
visual_data: CO_2 + H_2O \xrightarrow{\text{Carbonic Anhydrase}} H_2CO_3 \to HCO_3^- + H^+

subject: Biology
title: Circulatory Disorders
description: Hypertension (>140/90). CAD (Atherosclerosis - Ca/Fat deposits in arteries). Angina (Chest pain - low O2). Heart Failure (Pumping failure).
visual_data:
Cardiac Arrest: Heart stops beating
Heart Attack: Muscle damage due to no blood supply

subject: Biology
title: Human Skeleton (206 Bones)
description: Axial (80): Skull (22), Vertebral Column (26), Sternum (1), Ribs (12 pairs). Appendicular (126): Limbs (30x4), Girdles (Pectoral 4, Pelvic 2).
visual_data: \text{Ribs:} \; 1\text{-}7 \text{ True}, 8\text{-}10 \text{ False}, 11\text{-}12 \text{ Floating}

subject: Biology
title: Vestibular Apparatus (Balance)
description: Located above Cochlea. 3 Semicircular canals (Dynamic balance - Crista ampullaris). Otolith organ (Saccule & Utricle - Static balance - Macula).
visual_data:
Crista: Angular acceleration (Rotation)
Macula: Linear acceleration / Gravity (Tilt)

subject: Biology
title: Pineal Gland
description: Dorsal side of forebrain. Secretes Melatonin. Regulates Diurnal (24-hour) rhythm (Sleep-wake cycle, Body temp).
visual_data: \text{Melatonin} \propto \text{Darkness} \\ \text{Regulates: Sleep, Menstruation, Pigmentation}

subject: Biology
title: Contraceptive Methods
description: Barrier (Condoms, Diaphragms). IUDs (Copper T - suppress motility; LNG-20 - hormone releasing). Oral Pills (Saheli - Non-steroidal, Centchroman).
visual_data:
Surgical: Vasectomy (Male), Tubectomy (Female)
Natural: Periodic Abstinence, Withdrawal, Lactational Amenorrhea

subject: Biology
title: Mendelian Disorders
description: Haemophilia (Sex-linked Recessive - Clotting defect). Sickle Cell Anemia (Autosomal Recessive - HbS). Phenylketonuria (Inborn error of metabolism).
visual_data: \text{Haemophilia: X-linked (Carrier female transmits to son)} \\ \text{Sickle Cell: Glu } \to \text{ Val at 6th pos of } \beta \text{-chain}

subject: Biology
title: Industrial Melanism
description: Natural Selection evidence. England (1850s): White moths > Dark moths (Lichens on trees). England (1920s): Dark moths > White moths (Smoke/Soot killed lichens).
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 200 100' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect x='10' y='10' width='80' height='80' fill='#E5E7EB'/><circle cx='40' cy='50' r='10' fill='#fff' stroke='#000'/><circle cx='70' cy='50' r='10' fill='#000'/><text x='50' y='85' text-anchor='middle' font-size='8'>Pre-Industrial</text><rect x='110' y='10' width='80' height='80' fill='#4B5563'/><circle cx='140' cy='50' r='10' fill='#fff' stroke='#000'/><circle cx='170' cy='50' r='10' fill='#000'/><text x='150' y='85' text-anchor='middle' font-size='8' fill='#fff'>Post-Industrial</text></svg>

subject: Biology
title: B-Cells vs T-Cells
description: B-Lymphocytes: Produce Antibodies (Humoral Immunity). T-Lymphocytes: Help B-cells and kill infected cells directly (Cell Mediated Immunity - CMI).
visual_data: \text{CMI} \to \text{Graft Rejection (Organ Transplant)} \\ \text{Humoral} \to \text{Blood/Fluid response}

subject: Biology
title: Antibiotics
description: Chemical substances produced by microbes to kill others. Penicillin (First antibiotic - Alexander Fleming from Penicillium notatum). Chain & Florey established potential.
visual_data:
Source: Bacteria (Streptomyces), Fungi (Penicillium)
Action: Disupt cell wall synthesis (Bactericidal)

subject: Biology
title: Major Biomes
description: Tropical Rainforest (High temp, High rain). Desert (High temp, Low rain). Tundra (Low temp). Deciduous Forest (Shed leaves).
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 200 150' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><line x1='20' y1='130' x2='180' y2='130' stroke='#000'/><line x1='20' y1='10' x2='20' y2='130' stroke='#000'/><text x='100' y='145' font-size='10'>Precipitation</text><text x='5' y='70' font-size='10' transform='rotate(-90 5,70)'>Temperature</text><rect x='140' y='20' width='40' height='40' fill='#059669'/><text x='160' y='40' font-size='8' fill='#fff' text-anchor='middle'>Rainforest</text><rect x='30' y='20' width='40' height='40' fill='#FDE047'/><text x='50' y='40' font-size='8' text-anchor='middle'>Desert</text><rect x='30' y='90' width='40' height='30' fill='#93C5FD'/><text x='50' y='110' font-size='8' text-anchor='middle'>Tundra</text></svg>

subject: Biology
title: Secondary Growth in Root
description: Vascular cambium originates from tissue below phloem and Protoxylem. Forms a wavy ring which later becomes circular.
visual_data: \text{Dicots only (No sec growth in Monocots)} \\ \text{Cambium} \to \text{Sec Xylem (In) + Sec Phloem (Out)}

subject: Biology
title: ELISA
description: Enzyme Linked Immuno-Sorbent Assay. Diagnostic test for AIDS/STDs. Based on Antigen-Antibody interaction.
visual_data: \text{Substrate} \xrightarrow{\text{Enzyme-Linked Ab}} \text{Color Change (Positive)}

subject: Biology
title: Mollusca Features
description: Soft bodied, Calcareous shell. Body: Head, Muscular Foot, Visceral Hump. Mantle cavity (respiration/excretion). Radula (Rasping organ for feeding).
visual_data:
Examples: Pila (Apple Snail), Octopus (Devil fish)
2nd Largest Phylum (after Arthropoda)

subject: Biology
title: Cytoskeleton
description: Network of filamentous proteinaceous structures. Microtubules (Tubulin), Microfilaments (Actin). Functions: Support, Motility, Shape maintenance.
visual_data:
Microtubules: Spindle fibers, Cilia, Flagella
Microfilaments: Muscle contraction, Pseudopodia

subject: Biology
title: Class Pisces (Fishes)
description: Chondrichthyes (Cartilaginous - Shark/Scoliodon, Placoid scales, No Air bladder). Osteichthyes (Bony - Rohu/Labeo, Cycloid scales, Air bladder present).
visual_data:
Chondrichthyes: Mouth ventral, Gill slits separate (no operculum)
Osteichthyes: Mouth terminal, 4 pairs gills (with operculum)

subject: Biology
title: Class Amphibia
description: Dual life (Land + Water). 3-chambered heart (2 Auricles, 1 Ventricle). Respiration: Skin (Cutaneous), Lungs (Pulmonary), Gills (Larva).
visual_data:
Example: Rana (Frog), Bufo (Toad), Salamandra
Tympanum represents ear. Cloaca present.

subject: Biology
title: Class Reptilia
description: Creeping/Crawling mode. Dry cornified skin (Scales/Scutes). 3-chambered heart (4 in Crocodile). Cold-blooded (Poikilotherms).
visual_data:
Example: Chelone (Turtle), Naja (Cobra), Hemidactylus (Lizard)
Snake/Lizard shed skin as cast.

subject: Biology
title: Class Aves (Birds)
description: Feathers, Beak, Forelimbs modified to Wings. Pneumatic bones (Hollow). 4-chambered heart. Warm-blooded (Homeotherms). Double respiration (Air sacs).
visual_data:
Example: Corvus (Crow), Pavo (Peacock)
Digestive tract has Crop and Gizzard.

subject: Biology
title: Class Mammalia
description: Mammary glands (Milk). Hair on skin. External ear (Pinna). 4-chambered heart. Diaphragm. Mostly viviparous (Platypus is oviparous).
visual_data: Example: Macropus (Kangaroo), Balaenoptera (Blue Whale), Panthera

subject: Biology
title: Deficiency Symptoms
description: Chlorosis (Yellowing - N, K, Mg, S, Fe, Mn, Zn, Mo). Necrosis (Tissue death - Ca, Mg, Cu, K). Inhibition of Division (N, K, S, Mo).
visual_data:
Mobile elements (N, K, Mg): Symptoms in Old Leaves
Immobile elements (Ca, S): Symptoms in Young Leaves

subject: Biology
title: Cohesion-Tension Theory
description: Dixon & Joly. Water rises in tall trees due to Transpiration Pull. Cohesion (Water-Water), Adhesion (Water-Xylem), Surface Tension.
visual_data: \text{Transpiration} \to \text{Negative Pressure (Suction)} \to \text{Water Ascent}

subject: Biology
title: RAAS Mechanism
description: Renin-Angiotensin-Aldosterone System. Regulation of GFR. Low BP -> JG Cells release Renin -> Angiotensinogen to Angiotensin II -> Aldosterone (Adrenal Cortex).
visual_data: \text{Angiotensin II} \to \text{Vasoconstriction} + \text{Aldosterone} \\ \text{Aldosterone} \to \text{Na}^+ \text{/Water Reabsorption}

subject: Biology
title: Muscular Disorders
description: Myasthenia Gravis (Autoimmune - affects NMJ). Muscular Dystrophy (Genetic - degeneration). Tetany (Low Ca++ - spasms). Gout (Uric acid crystals in joints).
visual_data:
Osteoporosis: Age-related, Decreased bone mass (Low Estrogen)
Arthritis: Inflammation of joints

subject: Biology
title: Lipid Structure
description: Fatty Acids (R-COOH) + Glycerol (Tri-hydroxy propane). Triglyceride = 1 Glycerol + 3 Fatty Acids (Ester bond). Saturated (No double bond), Unsaturated (Double bond).
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 200 100' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect x='20' y='20' width='20' height='60' fill='#BFDBFE'/><text x='30' y='55' text-anchor='middle' font-size='8' transform='rotate(-90 30,55)'>Glycerol</text><rect x='50' y='25' width='100' height='10' fill='#FCA5A5'/><rect x='50' y='45' width='100' height='10' fill='#FCA5A5'/><rect x='50' y='65' width='100' height='10' fill='#FCA5A5'/><text x='100' y='33' text-anchor='middle' font-size='8'>Fatty Acid</text><text x='100' y='53' text-anchor='middle' font-size='8'>Fatty Acid</text><text x='100' y='73' text-anchor='middle' font-size='8'>Fatty Acid</text><line x1='40' y1='30' x2='50' y2='30' stroke='#000'/><line x1='40' y1='50' x2='50' y2='50' stroke='#000'/><line x1='40' y1='70' x2='50' y2='70' stroke='#000'/></svg>

subject: Biology
title: Protein Structure Levels
description: Primary (Sequence of AA). Secondary (Helix/Sheet - H-bonds). Tertiary (3D folding - Disulfide/Ionic bonds - Active form). Quaternary (Multiple polypeptides - Hb).
visual_data: \text{Primary: N-term to C-term} \\ \text{Secondary: } \alpha \text{-Helix (Keratin), } \beta \text{-Sheet (Silk)}

subject: Biology
title: Animal Breeding
description: Inbreeding (Same breed - increases homozygosity/pure line, but inbreeding depression). Outcrossing (Same breed, no common ancestor). Cross-breeding (Different breeds - Hisardale sheep).
visual_data:
MOET: Multiple Ovulation Embryo Transfer
Cow -> FSH -> 6-8 eggs -> AI -> Embryo recovery -> Surrogate

subject: Biology
title: Green Revolution Varieties
description: Wheat: Sonalika, Kalyan Sona (Norman Borlaug). Rice: Jaya, Ratna (IR-8). Sugarcane: Saccharum barberi (North) x S. officinarum (South).
visual_data:
Biofortification: Breeding for higher nutrient content
Example: Atlas 66 (Wheat - High Protein), Iron-fortified Rice

subject: Biology
title: Color Blindness
description: Sex-linked recessive disorder. Defect in Red/Green cones. More common in males (8%) than females (0.4%) because males have only one X chromosome.
visual_data: X^C Y \to \text{Affected Male} \\ X^C X \to \text{Carrier Female (Normal Vision)}

subject: Biology
title: Thalassemia
description: Autosomal recessive. Quantitative problem (Reduced synthesis of Globin chains). Alpha Thalassemia (Chr 16). Beta Thalassemia (Chr 11).
visual_data:
Alpha: Genes HBA1, HBA2
Beta: Gene HBB
Result: Anemia

subject: Biology
title: Kingdom Fungi Groups
description: Phycomycetes (Algal - Rhizopus). Ascomycetes (Sac - Yeast, Penicillium). Basidiomycetes (Club - Mushroom/Agaricus, Puccinia). Deuteromycetes (Imperfect - Trichoderma).
visual_data:
Sexual spores:
Ascospores (Endogenous)
Basidiospores (Exogenous)
Deuteromycetes: No sexual stage known

subject: Biology
title: Stem Modifications
description: Storage (Potato/Tuber, Ginger/Rhizome, Colocasia/Corm). Support (Tendrils - Cucumber). Protection (Thorns - Citrus). Photosynthesis (Phylloclade - Opuntia).
visual_data:
Offset: Aquatic (Pistia, Eichhornia)
Sucker: Chrysanthemum, Banana
Runner: Grasses

subject: Biology
title: Adaptations
description: Kangaroo Rat (Internal fat oxidation for water). Opuntia (Spines, Sunken stomata, CAM pathway). Mammals in cold (Allen's Rule - short ears/limbs).
visual_data:
Altitude Sickness: Low pO2 -> High RBCs, High breathing rate
Behavioral: Desert Lizard basks in sun

subject: Biology
title: Prokaryotic Envelope
description: 3 Layers: Glycocalyx (Slime layer/Capsule), Cell Wall (Peptidoglycan), Plasma Membrane (Mesosomes - respiration).
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 150 100' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect x='10' y='10' width='130' height='80' rx='20' fill='#F3F4F6' stroke='#000'/><rect x='15' y='15' width='120' height='70' rx='15' fill='#E5E7EB' stroke='#000'/><rect x='20' y='20' width='110' height='60' rx='10' fill='#D1FAE5' stroke='#000'/><text x='75' y='50' text-anchor='middle' font-size='8'>Cytoplasm (No Organelles)</text><text x='75' y='95' text-anchor='middle' font-size='6'>Outer: Glycocalyx, Middle: Wall, Inner: Membrane</text></svg>

subject: Biology
title: Male Reproductive System
description: Testis (Scrotum - low temp). Seminiferous Tubules (Sperm production). Epididymis (Storage). Vas Deferens. Glands: Seminal Vesicle (Fructose), Prostate, Bulbourethral.
visual_data: \text{Semen} = \text{Sperm} + \text{Seminal Plasma (Ca}^{++}\text{, Fructose, Enzymes)}

subject: Biology
title: Protozoan Groups
description: Amoeboid (Pseudopodia - Entamoeba). Flagellated (Trypanosoma - Sleeping sickness). Ciliated (Paramoecium - Gullet). Sporozoans (Plasmodium - Malaria).
visual_data:
Heterotrophs (Predators or Parasites)
Primitive relatives of animals

subject: Biology
title: Photosynthetic Pigments
description: Chlorophyll a (Bright green - Primary pigment). Chlorophyll b (Yellow green). Xanthophylls (Yellow). Carotenoids (Yellow-Orange).
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 200 100' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><path d='M10,90 Q50,10 90,90' fill='none' stroke='#10B981' stroke-width='2'/><text x='50' y='20' font-size='8' fill='#10B981'>Chl a (Blue/Red absorption)</text><path d='M110,90 Q150,30 190,90' fill='none' stroke='#F59E0B' stroke-width='2'/><text x='150' y='40' font-size='8' fill='#F59E0B'>Carotenoids</text><text x='100' y='95' text-anchor='middle' font-size='8'>Absorption Spectrum</text></svg>

subject: Biology
title: Theories of Origin of Life
description: Panspermia (Spores from space). Spontaneous Generation (Disproved by Louis Pasteur). Chemical Evolution (Oparin & Haldane - Life from non-living organic molecules).
visual_data:
Pasteur's Swan Neck Flask Experiment:
Life comes only from pre-existing life (Biogenesis)

subject: Biology
title: Innate Immunity Barriers
description: Physical (Skin, Mucus). Physiological (Acid in stomach, Tears). Cellular (PMNL-Neutrophils, Monocytes, Macrophages). Cytokine (Interferons - anti-viral).
visual_data:
PMNL: Polymorpho-Nuclear Leukocytes
First line of defense (Non-specific)

subject: Biology
title: Guttation
description: Loss of water as liquid droplets from leaf margins (Hydathodes). Caused by Root Pressure (positive pressure) usually at night/early morning.
visual_data: \text{Root Pressure} > \text{Transpiration} \to \text{Guttation}

subject: Biology
title: Cloning Vectors
description: Vehicles to transfer DNA. Plasmids (Bacteria). Bacteriophage (High copy number). BAC/YAC (For large DNA - HGP). Agrobacterium (Ti plasmid - Plants). Retrovirus (Animals).
visual_data:
Agrobacterium tumifaciens:
Natural Genetic Engineer of plants

subject: Biology
title: Biocontrol Agents
description: Ladybird (controls Aphids). Dragonfly (controls Mosquitoes). Bacillus thuringiensis (Caterpillars). Trichoderma (Root pathogens). Baculovirus/Nucleopolyhedrovirus (Specific to insects).
visual_data:
IPM: Integrated Pest Management
Avoid chemical pesticides

subject: Biology
title: Golgi Apparatus
description: Camillo Golgi. Cis face (forming) and Trans face (maturing). Functions: Packaging, Modification (Glycosylation - Glycoproteins/Glycolipids).
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 150 100' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><path d='M40,20 Q75,10 110,20' fill='none' stroke='#F59E0B' stroke-width='4'/><path d='M40,40 Q75,30 110,40' fill='none' stroke='#F59E0B' stroke-width='4'/><path d='M40,60 Q75,50 110,60' fill='none' stroke='#F59E0B' stroke-width='4'/><circle cx='120' cy='60' r='5' fill='#F59E0B'/><text x='130' y='60' font-size='6'>Vesicle</text><text x='20' y='40' font-size='8'>Cisternae</text></svg>

subject: Biology
title: Food Web vs Chain
description: Food Chain: Linear (Grass -> Goat -> Man). Food Web: Interconnected chains (More stable). GFC (Grazing Food Chain). DFC (Detritus Food Chain).
visual_data: \text{DFC (Decomposers)} \to \text{Major flow in terrestrial ecosystem} \\ \text{GFC} \to \text{Major flow in aquatic ecosystem}

subject: Biology
title: Vernalization
description: Flowering dependent on exposure to low temperature. Prevents precocious reproductive development. Winter varieties (Wheat/Barley) planted in autumn.
visual_data:
Promotes flowering in Biennials:
Cabbage, Sugarbeet, Carrot

subject: Biology
title: Family Solanaceae (Potato)
description: Vegetables (Potato, Tomato, Brinjal), Spice (Chilli), Medicine (Belladonna, Ashwagandha), Fumigatory (Tobacco).
visual_data: \oplus \, K_{(5)} \, \overbrace{C_{(5)} \, A_5} \, \underline{G}_{(2)} \\ \text{Epipetalous stamens, Axile placentation}

subject: Biology
title: Family Fabaceae (Pea/Bean)
description: Pulses (Gram, Arhar), Edible oil (Soybean, Groundnut), Dye (Indigofera), Fibres (Sunhemp), Fodder (Sesbania).
visual_data: \% \, K_{(5)} \, C_{1+2+(2)} \, A_{(9)+1} \, \underline{G}_1 \\ \text{Diadelphous, Vexillary aestivation}

subject: Biology
title: Family Liliaceae (Lily)
description: Ornamentals (Tulip, Gloriosa), Medicine (Aloe), Vegetables (Asparagus), Colchicine (Colchicum autumnale).
visual_data: \oplus \, \overbrace{P_{(3+3)} \, A_{3+3}} \, \underline{G}_{(3)} \\ \text{Epiphyllous stamens, Tricarpellary}

subject: Biology
title: Bioactive Molecules
description: Cyclosporin A (Immunosuppressant - Trichoderma polysporum). Statins (Cholesterol lowering - Monascus purpureus). Streptokinase (Clot buster - Streptococcus).
visual_data:
Lipase: Detergents (remove oil stains)
Pectinase/Protease: Clear bottled juices
Swiss Cheese: Large holes (CO2) by Propionibacterium

subject: Biology
title: Eutrophication
description: Natural aging of lake by nutrient enrichment (N, P). Cultural Eutrophication (accelerated by humans). Causes Algal Bloom -> O2 depletion -> Fish death.
visual_data: \text{Nutrients} \to \text{Algae} \uparrow \to \text{DO} \downarrow \to \text{BOD} \uparrow \to \text{Death}

subject: Biology
title: Dorsiventral vs Isobilateral Leaf
description: Dicot (Dorsiventral): Stomata mostly on lower surface, Mesophyll differentiated (Palisade + Spongy). Monocot (Isobilateral): Stomata on both surfaces, Mesophyll undifferentiated.
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 200 100' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect x='20' y='20' width='60' height='60' fill='#A7F3D0' stroke='#000'/><rect x='20' y='20' width='60' height='20' fill='#059669'/><text x='50' y='50' text-anchor='middle' font-size='6'>Dicot (Diff)</text><rect x='120' y='20' width='60' height='60' fill='#A7F3D0' stroke='#000'/><text x='150' y='50' text-anchor='middle' font-size='6'>Monocot (Same)</text><circle cx='130' cy='20' r='2' fill='#fff'/><circle cx='130' cy='80' r='2' fill='#fff'/><text x='150' y='90' font-size='6'>Stomata</text></svg>

subject: Biology
title: Bulliform Cells
description: Large, empty, colorless cells in epidermis of Grasses (Monocots). When turgid -> Leaf open. When flaccid (water stress) -> Leaf curls to reduce water loss.
visual_data: Adaptation to minimize Transpiration

subject: Biology
title: Ringworm (Fungal)
description: Caused by Microsporum, Trichophyton, Epidermophyton. Symptoms: Dry, scaly lesions, itching. Thrives in heat and moisture (skin folds).
visual_data: Infectious: Transmitted via towels, clothes, combs

subject: Biology
title: Ascariasis
description: Intestinal parasite (Ascaris lumbricoides). Eggs in faeces -> Soil -> Water/Vegetables. Internal bleeding, muscular pain, blockage of intestinal passage.
visual_data:
Prevention: Hygiene, Washing vegetables
Vector-less transmission (Direct)

subject: Biology
title: Elephantiasis (Filariasis)
description: Wuchereria bancrofti / W. malayi. Chronic inflammation of lymphatic vessels (lower limbs). Transmitted by Culex mosquito.
visual_data:
Vector: Culex (Female)
Symptom: Gross deformities of genital organs

subject: Biology
title: Single Cell Protein (SCP)
description: Alternative protein source for humans/animals. Spirulina (Blue-green algae), Methylophilus methylotrophus (Bacteria - high rate of biomass production).
visual_data: 250g \text{ Bacteria} \to 25 \text{ tonnes protein/day}

subject: Biology
title: Biofortification Examples
description: Breeding crops with higher vitamins/minerals. Vitamin A enriched Carrots/Spinach. Vitamin C enriched Bitter gourd. Iron enriched Rice.
visual_data: Goal: Reduce 'Hidden Hunger' (Micronutrient deficiency)

subject: Biology
title: Commensalism (+/0)
description: One benefits, other unaffected. 1. Orchid on Mango branch. 2. Barnacles on Whale. 3. Cattle Egret and grazing cattle. 4. Sea Anemone and Clown Fish.
visual_data:
Egret: Eats insects flushed out by cattle
Clown Fish: Protection from predators by stinging tentacles

subject: Biology
title: Phylum Arthropoda
description: Largest Phylum (2/3rd of all species). Jointed appendages. Chitinous exoskeleton. Molting (Ecdysis). Open circulatory system. Malpighian tubules.
visual_data:
Economical: Apis (Honey), Bombyx (Silk), Laccifer (Lac)
Vectors: Anopheles, Culex, Aedes
Living Fossil: Limulus (King Crab)

subject: Biology
title: Phylum Echinodermata
description: Spiny bodied. Endoskeleton of calcareous ossicles. Marine only. Water Vascular System (Locomotion, Respiration, Food capture).
visual_data:
Symmetry: Radial (Adult), Bilateral (Larva)
Ex: Asterias (Star fish), Echinus (Sea urchin)

subject: Biology
title: Phylum Hemichordata
description: Worm-like marine animals. Stomochord (rudimentary structure). Body: Proboscis, Collar, Trunk. Respiration by gills.
visual_data:
Ex: Balanoglossus, Saccoglossus
Connecting link between Non-chordates and Chordates

subject: Biology
title: Imbibition
description: Absorption of water by solids (colloids) causing increase in volume. Seed germination requires imbibition. Heat is released (Heat of Wetting).
visual_data: \text{Affinity between Adsorbent and Liquid is essential}

subject: Biology
title: Plasmolysis
description: Shrinkage of protoplast from cell wall when placed in Hypertonic solution (Exosmosis). Incipient -> Evident Plasmolysis. Deplasmolysis in Hypotonic.
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 150 100' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect x='10' y='10' width='130' height='80' fill='none' stroke='#000' stroke-width='2'/><path d='M20,20 Q40,40 20,80 Q60,90 120,80 Q130,40 120,20 Q60,10 20,20' fill='#FECACA' stroke='#EF4444'/><text x='75' y='50' text-anchor='middle' font-size='8'>Shrunken Protoplast</text><text x='75' y='95' text-anchor='middle' font-size='8'>Hypertonic Solution</text></svg>

subject: Biology
title: Solid Waste Management
description: Sanitary Landfills (leachate problem). Incineration (Hospital waste). Recycling (Plastics - Ahmed Khan's Polyblend for roads). E-waste (Gold recovery - Toxic).
visual_data: Polyblend + Bitumen = Water repellent roads (Bangalore)

subject: Biology
title: Deforestation Case Studies
description: Chipko Movement (1974, Garhwal Himalayas - Sunderlal Bahuguna). Amrita Devi Bishnoi (1731, Rajasthan - sacrificed life for Khejri trees).
visual_data: JFM: Joint Forest Management (1980s) - Local communities protect forests

subject: Biology
title: In-situ Conservation
description: On-site. Hotspots (Western Ghats), Biosphere Reserves (14 in India), National Parks (90), Sanctuaries (448), Sacred Groves (Khasi Hills, Aravalli).
visual_data: Sacred Groves: Last refuge for large number of rare plants

subject: Biology
title: MTP (Medical Termination of Pregnancy)
description: Legalized in India 1971. Safe up to 1st Trimester (12 weeks). Used for contraceptive failure, rape, or health risk.
visual_data: Amniocentesis: Sex determination (Banned)

subject: Biology
title: Applications of PCR
description: Early diagnosis of pathogens (Detects low concentration). HIV in suspected AIDS. Genetic mutations in Cancer. DNA Fingerprinting.
visual_data: \text{Amplification} \to \text{Detection}

subject: Biology
title: Transgenic Animals
description: Rosie (First Transgenic Cow - Human alpha-lactalbumin enriched milk, 2.4g/L). Mice (Polio vaccine safety). Sheep (Tracey - alpha-1-antitrypsin for Emphysema).
visual_data: 95% of Transgenic animals are Mice

subject: Biology
title: Significance of Meiosis
description: 1. Conservation of chromosome number across generations (2n -> n). 2. Genetic variability (Crossing over). 3. Evolution.
visual_data: \text{Variation} \to \text{Raw material for Evolution}

subject: Biology
title: Absolute vs Relative Growth
description: Absolute: Total growth per unit time. Relative: Growth per unit initial parameter. (Leaf A 5->10cm vs Leaf B 50->55cm. Absolute same, Relative A > B).
visual_data: RGR = \frac{\text{Growth}}{\text{Time} \times \text{Initial Size}}

subject: Biology
title: Pyramid of Energy
description: Always Upright. Energy flow is unidirectional. 10% Law (Lindeman): Only 10% energy transferred to next trophic level.
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 200 150' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><polygon points='100,20 180,140 20,140' fill='#FDE68A' stroke='#D97706'/><line x1='35' y1='110' x2='165' y2='110' stroke='#D97706'/><line x1='50' y1='80' x2='150' y2='80' stroke='#D97706'/><text x='100' y='130' text-anchor='middle' font-size='8'>Producers (1000J)</text><text x='100' y='100' text-anchor='middle' font-size='8'>Pri. Cons (100J)</text><text x='100' y='70' text-anchor='middle' font-size='8'>Sec. Cons (10J)</text><text x='100' y='40' text-anchor='middle' font-size='8'>Top (1J)</text></svg>

subject: Biology
title: DNA vs RNA Stability
description: DNA (Deoxyribose) lacks 2'-OH -> More stable, chemically less reactive. RNA (Ribose) has 2'-OH -> Labile, catalytic (Ribozyme).
visual_data:
DNA: Genetic material (Storage)
RNA: Transmission of information / Catalysis

subject: Biology
title: Divergent vs Convergent
description: Homologous (Divergent): Same origin (Vertebrate heart/brain). Analogous (Convergent): Different origin (Potato/Sweet Potato, Flippers of Penguin/Dolphin).
visual_data: \text{Homologous} \to \text{Ancestry} \\ \text{Analogous} \to \text{Habitat}

subject: Biology
title: Protocols
description: Montreal Protocol (1987, Canada): Control ODS (Ozone Depleting Substances - CFCs). Kyoto Protocol (1997, Japan): Control Greenhouse Gases (Climate Change).
visual_data:
Montreal: Ozone protection
Kyoto: Global Warming

subject: Biology
title: Famous Scientists & Discoveries
description: Schleiden & Schwann (Cell Theory). Rudolf Virchow (Omnis cellula-e cellula). Singer & Nicolson (Fluid Mosaic). Watson & Crick (DNA Double Helix).
visual_data:
Mendel: Father of Genetics
Morgan: Linkage (Fruit fly)
Sutton & Boveri: Chromosomal Theory
Darwin: Natural Selection

subject: Biology
title: Phylum Porifera (Sponges)
description: Primitive, multicellular, cellular level of organization. Water Canal System (Ostia -> Spongocoel -> Osculum). Choanocytes (Collar cells).
visual_data:
Skeleton: Spicules/Spongin fibers
Examples: Sycon, Spongilla (Freshwater), Euspongia (Bath sponge)

subject: Biology
title: Phylum Ctenophora (Sea Walnuts)
description: Marine, Radial symmetry, Diploblastic. 8 external rows of ciliated Comb Plates (Locomotion). Bioluminescence (emit light).
visual_data:
Example: Pleurobrachia, Ctenoplana
Property: Bioluminescence

subject: Biology
title: Phylum Platyhelminthes (Flatworms)
description: Dorso-ventrally flattened. Acoelomate. Bilateral symmetry. Flame cells (Osmoregulation/Excretion). Hooks and Suckers in parasites.
visual_data:
Example: Taenia (Tapeworm), Fasciola (Liver fluke)
Regeneration: Planaria (High capacity)

subject: Biology
title: Phylum Annelida (Ringed Worms)
description: Metamerism (Segmentation). Coelomate. Nephridia (Excretion). Longitudinal and Circular muscles (Locomotion). Closed circulatory system.
visual_data: Example: Pheretima (Earthworm), Nereis (Parapodia), Hirudinaria (Leech)

subject: Biology
title: Frog Anatomy (Rana tigrina)
description: Cloaca (Common opening for digestive, excretory, reproductive). 3-chambered heart. Respiration: Skin (Cutaneous), Lungs (Pulmonary), Buccal cavity.
visual_data:
Excretion: Ureotelic (Urea)
Copulatory pad: On first digit of forelimb (Male)

subject: Biology
title: Cockroach Vision (Mosaic)
description: Compound eyes with 2000 Ommatidia. Mosaic vision: High sensitivity but Low resolution (Nocturnal vision).
visual_data:
Spiracles: 10 pairs for respiration
Malpighian tubules: Excretion

subject: Biology
title: Simple Permanent Tissues
description: Parenchyma (Storage, Photosynthesis - Living). Collenchyma (Mechanical support in young stems - Living, thickened corners). Sclerenchyma (Dead, lignified - Fibres/Sclereids).
visual_data:
Collenchyma: Thickened with Cellulose/Pectin
Sclerenchyma: Thickened with Lignin (Nuts, Pulp of Guava)

subject: Biology
title: Meiosis II (Equational)
description: Resembles Mitosis. Prophase II -> Metaphase II (Chromosomes align) -> Anaphase II (Centromere splits) -> Telophase II (4 Haploid cells).
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 200 100' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><circle cx='50' cy='50' r='40' fill='none' stroke='#000'/><line x1='50' y1='20' x2='50' y2='80' stroke='#EF4444' stroke-width='2'/><text x='50' y='95' text-anchor='middle' font-size='8'>Metaphase II</text><path d='M120,50 L140,50' stroke='#000' marker-end='url(#arrow)'/><circle cx='180' cy='30' r='15' fill='none' stroke='#000'/><circle cx='180' cy='70' r='15' fill='none' stroke='#000'/><text x='180' y='95' text-anchor='middle' font-size='8'>4 Daughter Cells</text></svg>

subject: Biology
title: Population Attributes
description: Birth Rate (Natality). Death Rate (Mortality). Sex Ratio (Males per 1000 Females). Age Distribution (Pre-reproductive, Reproductive, Post-reproductive).
visual_data: \text{Growth} = (\text{Birth} + \text{Immigration}) - (\text{Death} + \text{Emigration})

subject: Biology
title: Enzyme Co-factors
description: Non-protein part essential for activity. Prosthetic Group (Tightly bound - Haem in Peroxidase). Co-enzyme (Transient - NAD/NADP). Metal Ions (Zn in Carboxypeptidase).
visual_data: Apoenzyme (Protein) + Co-factor = Holoenzyme (Active)

subject: Biology
title: Geological Time Scale
description: Paleozoic (Invertebrates/Fish). Mesozoic (Reptiles/Dinosaurs). Cenozoic (Mammals/Humans).
visual_data:
Jurassic: Age of Dinosaurs
Devonian: Age of Fishes
Carboniferous: Coal formation

subject: Biology
title: Drugs & Sources Summary
description: Morphine (Latex of Poppy). Cannabinoids (Inflorescence of Cannabis). Cocaine (Erythroxylum coca). LSD (Fungus Claviceps).
visual_data:
Tobacco: Nicotine (Stimulates Adrenal gland)
Alcohol: Depressant, affects Cerebellum

subject: Biology
title: Ozone Hole Mechanism
description: Antarctic Region. UV breaks CFCs -> Cl atoms -> Cl converts Ozone to Oxygen. Cl acts as catalyst (not consumed). Thinning of shield.
visual_data: Cl + O_3 \to ClO + O_2 \\ ClO + O \to Cl + O_2

subject: Biology
title: Pedigree: Autosomal vs Sex-Linked
description: Autosomal Dominant: Does not skip generations (Myotonic Dystrophy). Autosomal Recessive: Skips generations (Sickle Cell). Sex-Linked: Criss-cross inheritance (Haemophilia).
visual_data: <svg viewBox='0 0 150 100' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect x='50' y='10' width='20' height='20' fill='#EF4444'/><circle cx='100' cy='20' r='10' fill='none' stroke='#000'/><line x1='70' y1='20' x2='90' y2='20' stroke='#000'/><line x1='80' y1='20' x2='80' y2='50' stroke='#000'/><rect x='60' y='60' width='20' height='20' fill='#EF4444'/><circle cx='100' cy='70' r='10' fill='#EF4444'/><text x='75' y='95' text-anchor='middle' font-size='8'>Dominant (No Skip)</text></svg>

subject: Biology
title: Taxonomic Hierarchy
description: Arrangement of categories. Species (Basic unit) -> Genus -> Family -> Order -> Class -> Phylum/Division -> Kingdom.
visual_data:
Mnemonic: 'Keep Pot Clean Or Family Gets Sick'
Potato: Solanum tuberosum
Human: Homo sapiens (Order: Primata, Class: Mammalia)

subject: Biology
title: Binomial Nomenclature
description: Carolus Linnaeus. Two components: Generic name (Capitalized) + Specific epithet (Lower case). Latinized and written in Italics (or underlined).
visual_data:
Example: Mangifera indica (Mango)
Author citation: Mangifera indica Linn.

subject: Biology
title: Taxonomic Aids
description: Herbarium (Dried plant sheets). Botanical Gardens (Living plants - Kew, NBRI). Museum (Preserved specimens). Zoological Parks (Wild animals).
visual_data:
Key: Analytical device (Couplet of contrasting characters)
Flora: Index of plants in a given area

subject: Biology
title: Defining Properties of Life
description: Metabolism (Sum of all chemical reactions) and Consciousness (Response to stimuli) are defining properties. Growth and Reproduction are NOT defining (exceptions exist).
visual_data: \text{Mule/Worker Bee} \to \text{Sterile (No Reproduction)} \\ \text{Sand Dune} \to \text{Grows (Accumulation)}

subject: Biology
title: Endomembrane System
description: Functionally coordinated organelles. ER (Synthesis) -> Golgi (Packaging) -> Lysosome (Digestion) -> Vacuole (Storage).
visual_data: \text{GERL System} \\ \text{Mitochondria/Chloroplast NOT included (Independent)}
